column5: Really disappointed finally got the go ahead that we could get tesco direct sent to BFPO and to make an order of over ¬£500 to get to the checkout to find out I could only order about 25 % of my order as the companies that supply to tesco won t deliver to BFPO! I am willing to name and shame these companies but I feel more disappointed that we were so excited that tesco had finally sorted it to deliver to BFPO when it is false advertising because most of your products are delivered direct from other companies who won t deliver to us!

Shame on Tesco  cut my coupon out to get my free firework when spending ¬£30 on fireworks. Walk to store excitedly........oh no we aren t allowed to give you that offer due to safety queries!!! Really then you won t be getting my custom for fireworks. Bye
Tesco I m very disappointed that you send me a 7 pound voucher to spend on a 50 pound shop   yet the date is until the 30th October and it came in the post today  today is the 31st Oct  oh well!
Can someone please explain to me what a  chow chow  is on the vegetable button of your self scan machines  where  bananas  used to be. So friggin annoying.
Absolutly disgusted to have been overtaken in a 30 limit by one of your home delivery vans when i was doing the limit!
Can you confirm when the Widnes store will cease 24hr opening?
As if tesco dudley have the Christmas tree up already.  I mean Halloween wasn t even over. Talk about shoving it down your neck.

A message for Tesco Bideford......Tesco!!! Where are the  free from dairy  chocolate muffins and brownies??? You can t do this to me Tesco! I thought we had a deal? Am I gonna have to go to asda? üò≠ I neeeeed my dairy free chocolate fix. Seriously  Asda s free from millionaires bites are really good but I don t wanna have to cheat on you Tesco. Can you please just restock them.  Many thanks  namaste Xx üòò

I d just like to say a massive thank you to Steve Hill and the staff at brading Road  Ryde Tesco on the IOW for being so helpful this evening. I work at a local primary school and asked what happened to the Halloween bunting and the very large cardboard spooky house after Halloween  as the possibilities for enhancing learning at school were endless and they couldn t have done more to help after saying I could take it! The team dismantled it for me  helped me carry it to my car and were genuinely interested in what I would do with it and were pleased for it to go to a good home! Great customer service and such a willingness to help when I m sure it would have been much easier for them to just bin it!  Thank you so much :)  From a very happy Reception teacher & no doubt some very excited children in the morning!
Why... ? Why... ? Why... ? The Tesco Rich Tea Finger packets...  Some packets of these biscuits are cooked nice and some packets tastes and also look uncooked?  Real disappointment.

Hi had my eyes tested today at your scunthorpe branch  I have never been before even though I have lived in Scunthorpe all my life  but family have so in need thought I d give it a try. I can honestly say how pleased I was with the service from start to finish I was greeted by this friendly lovely lady who was professional and polite and very thorough  I proceeded to have a chap called David to do the actual eye test and he also was very professional  he put me at ease and was very friendly!!! I ordered my glasses no problems which was really reasonable prices also!! I would like to thank the opticians in scunthorpe and would recommend to anyone needing an eye yes especially if a little apprehensive about having one as it s a little intrusive but needs must!! üòâüôèüèª
Company is a joke never received goods i ordered and customer service are not bothered when you ring. They just like ripping people off.
Tesco  you ve made me very sad this evening üòû Anybody I can talk to about this?

Today I went to my local Tesco on Hayling Island  Station Road  which at the moment runs the Groundworks Community Scheme  where you get to vote for one of the 3 projects selected. I spent about ¬£30 on my daily shop and after I paid for my shopping I queried how can I vote. I was informed that because I did not purchased a carrier bag I could not vote. Really! I thought that the whole point of supermarkets charging for carrier bags is to reduce the usage of them and now if I would like to vote I am being encourage to purchase a bag I don t need? Why? I would understand if Tesco put a limit -  lets say of ¬£10 of money spent on shopping before customer is allowed to vote  but encouraging plastic bag purchasing seems wrong! Please  can you explain to me the reasoning behind Tesco s thinking for having to purchase a disposable bag to be allowed to vote? Surely spending money on shopping should be enough to qualify to vote. Thank you.

We deliberated about posting this as we re not usually big complainers; however  my wife and I felt strongly about this one...   We were really pleased to have saved just shy of ¬£50 worth of Clubcard vouchers which we thought would double up to ¬£100 with  Tesco Direct  to put towards Christmas presents for our daughter.   Imagine our disappointment to find out that this is no longer the case having read a poorly publicised article stating that the last ever event was last May. It has also taken the edge off the card we received from Tesco celebrating our 350th shop with you and a slightly ironic award of an extra 250 Clubcard points!  With the cost of living increasing rapidly again  this really would have assisted with the expense of Christmas. Not the way to keep customers I m afraid :(.
@Tesco  Hi  can you use the Alton towers club card boost on the 5th Nov? Thanks ü§ó

Really disappointed Tesco... went to cook some sea bass fillets for my family tonight that I had freshly filleted in your Peterborough extra store... full of bones and still covered in scales. Not what I asked for and now completely wrecked what I had planned for dinner. For the money I paid am really disappointed.
Hello. Could I just ask why all the turkeys in the Christmas brochure say  contains milk ?   No problem I m just a bit confused üòÇ
bought donuts at tesco today - would have preferred them to be a bit fresher tasting considering its a monday - wish I d gone to morrisons
Well done to tesco for selling eggs to the young kids that have now egged the local houses.
Can you put Food bank collection points in more stores especially rhe Dinnington one please. I have to go to Morrisons tomorrow to buy and donate.

Chat conversation start  Very disappointed that Tesco will not honour a Lego 3 for 2 as advertised. I purchased 3 items with no discount applied at the online checkout  it appears that  the offer is not being honoured because one of the items cannot be collected from a store and has to be home delivered. Ridiculous. Order number 4DN9TWPPG

Placed order for a non-food item but did not realise until it has been dispatched that the system picked up my delivery instructions for food delivery which is back door and I want this delivery to front door.

I bought a 250g packet of Tesco  PEEELED  Brussels Sprouts  for which  I assume  I paid a premium as they were pre-prepared. However  I had to peel about a third of them myself. Whatever happened to quality control?
Thanks for the Halloween activity pack in my Tesco delivery today. Kept my daughter busy while waiting to go trick or treating!

COMPLAINT -  Shopping ordered 30/10/16 online - payment made. This evening I received a phone call from  ALRIC  on behalf of Tesco  who advised me there was a problem with my payment.  There was no problem in rectifying this problem  as I was very happy to confirm all details of the payment and correct any errors that had clearly occurred (as the payment had shown cleared on my account the day before). However  throughout the entire telephone conversation  I found  Alric  to be extremely short tempered  abrupt and bordering rude to me.  I found this completely unnecessary as it was obviously a hiccup within the system and  Alric  was not at all representative of the excellent customer service that I would expect from Tesco.  It took a long time for him to explain the situation to me (he went all round the houses with it - confusing himself and me!)  hence it took  longer than it really should have to reach a resolution - an error in the expiry date as it turned out.  He made me feel very negative about a situation that could have been sorted far quicker had he adopted a more positive attitude.  Very disappointing customer service from Tesco!

So Tesco Groceries Online you have lost yourselves a customer who has spent between ¬£40-¬£100 each week for the last fifteen months. Got issues  no phone call back as promised so I m taking my business elsewhere üò°

queried price of compeed heel plasters as charged ¬£6.50 and shelf said ¬£4 but was still charged ¬£6.50 - only to find them in Savers today at ¬£2.99 (have photo on mobile) abs disgusted Tesco as loyal customer - must do better !!!

I m thoroughly disappointed  I went online to order 3 Etch a sketches and they were out of stock  I searched for my nearest store which did have them in stock  it was seven and a half miles away. Before I made my way there I called to check that they did in fact have stock. The automated message stated that stock could not be checked and items could not be reserved-great service. I still spoke to a lovely lady who confirmed that the offer was still on in store and as I would have to travel there by myself with a one year old during rush hour  offered to check the stock for me- there were seven in store. So we travelled to the store  got the three etch a sketches  but as they weren t in the toy aisle I went to customer services to check. The lady searched and came back and said that they were on the tills as stationary and so was not part of the offer. This meant that instead of paying the ¬£24 had I been able to buy them online  I would have to pay ¬£45. I explained about the phone call and how on the website they were a different price and in the offer. The explanation I was given was that they had had a few things like that. Needless to say  I wont be trusting the website or phone calls again.

Not very happy with Tesco Bedford Riverside  have been trying to buy Joint Ace on offer at present 3 for 2 for the last 6 out of 10 days but they only every had 2 on the shelf. When asked when will the next delivery come  the customer advisor did not know. My husband and I have found more recently that the selection is not a good as it used to be. For example we haven t seen a marrow on the shelves for a few months. I am certainly contemplating either changing to a different shopermarket or having to travel further afield to Tescos in Milton Keynes to get the choices we like.
Hi I would like to ask about job applications to the new Claires s Accessories concession in the Tesco extra in Borehamwood on Snenley Road ? X
Any plans of linking the online menu planner to the app so you can order without having to login again?

I wish supermarkets would realise that vegatarians do actually eat a variety of foods. At home I use quorn chicken and make bbq chicken and salad rolls  hullumi and sweet chilli wraps  quorn chicken and sweetcorn rolls; the list is endless. ...however when I m in a rush or fancy a quick fix   I am so sick of the only options for veggies in Tescos ready made sections being something with cheese; cheese and onion  cheese and pickle  cheddar ploughman or egg; egg and cress or egg mayo. The only other option is a falafel wrap which tastes disgusting and on the very very odd occasion a three bean wrap which are not in very often. After 3 years it gets very very boring... Wish supermarkets would realise that we do actually eat other things. I understand Quorn is a product of its own so supermarkets maybe can t use it in their fillings  but the same old cheddar cheese or egg and cress is very old and very bland next to all the exciting new flavours brought out for meat eaters. Even Asda have cottoned on and have at least brought out a veggie sushi which changes things up a little. Really wish you would sort this out Tesco :(

So  I bought an item from Tesco in Luton. Took it back to Tesco in St Albans and because St Albans Tesco do not sell the item I bought in Luton  you refused to give me a refund!  Tesco is Tesco isn t it. I can t imaging any other supermarket has this policy?  Not happy but relieved that I didn t buy it in Edinburgh!!

Thanks you to Ellie and Terri for their help today. So to clarify. This evening I have to go to Tesco Purley  collect a Hoover that doesn t belong to me andwhich I haven t paid for. And which also happens to be broken. And then take it back home with me.  Right - that makes sense !!!
Also  I would consider getting rid of your parent and child spaces - there s never any left for actual parents and children as so many other shoppers sans children park there.

Came to your Pitsea store on Friday evening and purchased my daughter two of your bras  we paid via your self scan hand held devices and totally forgot to get the security tags taken off at the checkout (as they were one of the first items packed at the bottom of the trolley) realised when we got home so had to make the 10 mile round trip again on Sunday to have them removed  to be told by your customer services what wally s we were  well Tesco maybe it is you who are the wally s spending all that time  effort and money to put the tags on to not even have the alarms working at the door so we would have been notified along with your security guard  and also wally s to employ such rude customer service staff!!

Been waiting fifteen minutes to collect my parcel at your Islington green store and although I ve been asked what I m waiting for nobody has actually checked my reference and gone to look yet. The que is building now!

Did a direct order for a book to be sent to ALVASTON Express was told be there for Friday. I ve had no notification from either the store or Tesco themselves whether it s there or not  even the tracking stops at Lichfield! Emailed Tesco and again no word in response. Could got it from Amazon delivered and read by now! 4DK4PJGGV
Keep trying to your your 10% off coupon selected large kitchen appliances but it keeps saying it s expired?!?!

Hi Tesco  please advise of who I can contact regarding g terrible customer service on 2 occasions regarding the same complaint  basically we have been fobbed off! The customer services (telephone number on the back of the reciept) are appealing and the store in question the manager walked off whilst mid conversation and sent someone else to speak with us as she couldn t be bothered to deal with us. Fuming! I want to discuss my complaint in full and expect some sort of apology and resolution. Please advise on who I can call.

Really disappointed with your pumpkins at the Catterick Garrison store. We have had to throw out pumpkins away today as they were all rotten. 3 very disappointed children as they can t take them to go trick or treating. üò°üò°üò°
Suprising me when I would like to use nursing room at Tesco Kota Bharu.The room is dirty and only provide small sofa with a bench.It is not really comfortable.Previously they provided a big sofa.

Is there some sort of chicken shortage in the world? Perhaps a re-brand of your Spicy Chicken Pasta is in order? Might I suggest renaming it simply  tomato pasta flavoured with the bitter tears of disappointment  as it would be more accurate.   TL:DR? There was not a single piece of chicken in my Spicy Chicken Pasta this lunch. üôÅ  Have I hurt you in some way? I thought we were stronger than this  Tesco. üòî

Very unimpressed with tesco today. Awaiting a delivery today of an item which the seller realised was advertised at the wrong price and tesco sends me an email to say they can t deliver due to stock shortage. Blatant lie as still able to buy the item but at a much more expensive price. Either honour your own mistakes or man up and tell the truth. Disgusted. Christmas shopping will be done elsewhere this year.
Thank you for the two chunks of chicken in your Spicy Chicken Pasta. I m overwhelmed by your generosity.

I have tried to complain about Tesco opticians mayflower Basildon & my post has disappeared & Tesco won t let me post it again  because they said I a duplicating a post. Stay away from Tesco opticians they conned me & they won t call or reply to me

Absolutely fuming!!  My tesco order  due between 8 and 9pm last night didn t arrive.  Had a voicemail just after 9 saying he was just coming up to the Runcorn bridge and would be another half an hour.  Didn t arrive.  A couple of hours later tweeted them and contacted them via the website.  I ve just phoned and apparently my shopping had been delivered the van came back empty and the delivery was signed for!!  It contained sweets for Halloween  so thanks Tesco driver  that s great!!!  I ve had to re-book the delivery for tomorrow and pay out again until they can refund me.  I m on benefits  so thanks for that and also  I have agoraphobia  so can t get out to buy more sweets  so sorry kids  I ll just have to ignore you tonight. Fuming!  I thought the vans were all tracked now anyway so how don t they know if he came to our address or not.  They re going to phone me when they talk to the driver later.  I can t wait to see what he has to say.

I have complained about Tesco mayflower opticians on Tesco  s page & it  disappears I wonder why?? I went to Tesco mayflower opticians in school summer holidays for glasses for me & my son. They adamantly told me my son was not allowed a NHS voucher. ( because my son went for a contact lense consult? I have an email off the NHS that proves you cannot use a voucher contact lenses consult. I paid cash for it & never signed for a voucher). The manager called me liar when they tried to give me 2 pairs of glasses when I ordered 4 pairs ( 2 for reading & 2 for TV & driving) I ordered them in a bogof deal. They also tried to overcharge me for my glasses. I have phoned their customer services and have received different answers every time as to why I have been over charged and to complain about the manager.I have never had a call off tesco to give me answers. I think they just ignore people in hope they go away. I have copied & pasted this complaint & will keep putting this post back up
where has the Barbara Daly make up gone from tesco stores? Where can I buy now?

Ford Mondeo car insurance RIP off from Tesco s . Had A Mondeo replaced with a Mondeo and went From ¬£44.49  to ¬£94.71    went on go compare at AXA its ¬£48.27 .  Only just starting using them again after the not withdraw paper issues   be a cold day in Hell before I do again
Tesco all out of pumpkins dunnes stores cornelscourt and rathmines have loads of pumpkins if anyone s looking

Oh dear. Was feeling rather bright and cheerful this morning until a very stressful traumatic phonecall from the Tesco Claims Department. Terrible customer service - unlike the amazing service I ve received so far from the Manager of the Purley Store.  Hoping my nightmare situation is sorted soon by Tesco.

I am really annoyed to find you no longer double the clubcard voucher values.... I save my vouchers throughout the year specifically for this so I have a boost at Christmas for kids presents.  Not happy :(

Hey Tesco  you owe me a breakfast and a manicure  and can consider yourselves lucky you aren t facing an injury compensation claim too. What is it with you people and plastic packaging? After an early start with the chores on this beautiful autumn morning  I thought I d take a break from the usual healthy eating and treat myself to a nice thick bacon sandwich. Great I thought  this will hit the spot. That was before I was confronted by a sinister enemy that just wasn t prepared to go down without a fight  the bacon. Now I know I m not exactly built like Arnold Scwarzenegger but I like to think that I m a reasonably strong man and should have no problem opening a packet of bacon  especially when those nice Tesco people have left a convenient little flap on the corner of the packet to be able to peel back the lid. However  this was anything but the case because your suppliers seem to be under the impression that the product shouldn t be just sealed but arc welded too. After the first few attempts just slipped through the fingers (very little purchase on such a small area of plastic). I know  I thought to myself  I ll get my thumbnail under it  that should give me the necessary leverage. CRACK! No it didn t  it just broke my thumbnail. Next it was on to using my teeth (not very hygienic I know but by now desperation is setting in) and more to the point this didn t work either  it just kept slipping through my clenched teeth. By now  even though I m a pretty laid back kind of guy  I m starting to take it personally and finally decided I needed backup  The Knife. I realised immediately that this was too big a job for a simple table knife and was going to require the stabbing skills of a pointed knife  preferably with a serrated edge. So  armed with my favourite 6 inch blade I set off on my latest mission. Approaching the packet of bacon for the umpteenth time  like a marine storming a foreign beach in wartime I was filled with adrenalin and a mixture of excitement  fear  anger and bravado. I even said to the pack  let s see what you ve got. This time it s just you  me and the knife . It s at this point I finally lost the war and my appetite for bacon  because the knife decided to defect to the other side by refusing to pierce the film but slide off of it and stab my other hand instead. This isn t the first time I ve had to do battle with a packet of bacon but if a hospital trip is the price of a bacon sandwich it sure will be the last.
Has any one seen the New Tesco free gluten  wheat and no milk choc selection box  in their tescos. if so can you put up where please. i am looking for these please x

Thankyou Tesco for kindly donating ten pumpkins to my sons school  RSD Derby for a pumpkin carving activity morning. Big thumbs down to Morrisons and Sainsburys who wouldn t donate any until the 1st Nov  after the event!
Thank you Tesco for your generous Christmas yet. With the Initial statement  A little help  on your booklets. I think we help ourselves by earning the points. Merry Christmas

Hi Tesco! I had my shopping delivered on Thursday (27/10) last week. My partner accepted the delivery. In my receipt theres one item with a short date (beef mince 30/10/16) which we accepted. Upon further inspection  there werw a number of products with short dates that we weren t made aware of.  Chicken breast fillets - 30/10/16 Kingsmill wholemeal crustless bread -30/10/16 Strawberries - 29/10/16 Weight watchers wraps - 28/10/16  Why weren t these products pointed out to us? I d have certainly returned some of them at the time had we been made aware of the short dates :(
We had your British pork shoulder yesterday is was excellent   Thank you   Alexis

This is about a TV we bought from you and had to send back for repair. First we received this message   Thank you for your message  I have checked the progress of your repair and can confirm that unfortunately your item was found to be beyond economic repair.   As this item is over 3 years of age due to depreciation there is no residual value left to refund.   This item has now been put through our internal recycling process on your behalf.   If we can be of any further assistance please do not hesitate to contact us.   Kind regards   Chris   Customer Service Representative  Tesco Outlet  Since the television had only been used for about 2 hours a week  we asked for a partial refund. We received this reply from you   Thank you for your message   As your product was was out of warranty what the issue was reported to us on the 20.9.16  however in line with your consumer rights we offered to return your item for possible repair. Unfortunately due to the age of the system replacement components had become obsolete and and therfore rendered the unit beyond economic repair.    As the item exceeds three years of age we contest that this item had any intrinsic fault  as such faults normally found within the first six months of usage. In addition with regards to any information provided to the amount of usage as this can not be substantiated it is nothing more than hearsay and superfluous to our decision.   This decision is final and we are not prepared to enter into any discussion with regards to a compensation claim.   Kind regards   Chris ‚Äã  Customer Service Representative  Tesco Outlet  I don t accept that 200 hours of use is an acceptable length of service for a television. Clearly it was designed badly or it was made badly.   Are you really not willing even to entertain any responsibility for selling this item?  Kind regards

Been a loyal delivery saver customer for years and have always said I d never go elsewhere as Tesco really looked after their regular customers with clubcard points that could be saved and doubled on gifts at Christmas (¬£150 doubled to ¬£300 every year for me)  money off petrol (which for me amounted to 20p off a litre twice a month) and lots of money off vouchers in the post  refunds for shopping that cost more than the other supermarkets  not to mention deliveries several times a week for only ¬£6 a month. Times must be hard for Tesco these days as none of these offers apply any longer other than the ¬£6 a month delivery saver and even at that you have to spend ¬£40 now. Which means if your driver forgets to give you half of your shopping and leaves you with 3 half dinners (like what happened to me on Saturday) and you have to reorder the stuff  you have to order a load of stuff you don t need just to meet the minimum delivery. No money off vouchers any more  no clubcard boost  no petrol discounts. Nothing. Not much reason to be loyal to Tesco any more. This comes from someone who posted on your wall a year ago saying how good it was to be a Tesco customer. Not feeling loved any more Tesco. You ve really let yourself go.

Disappointed to have filled my basket with a ¬£10 Meal Deal this morning amongst other shopping only to find once at the checkout that it hadn t come up as a ¬£10 Meal Deal. I paid the full amount for the four items and was told it could be more easily sorted out at customer services. I went to customer services where the assistant asked if I was sure I had actually picked the items from the ¬£10 Meal Deal display? Where the Hell did she think I d got them from? There was not enough staff to check if I had indeed picked up the correct combination for a Meal Deal so she offered me a refund on the said items. I suspect the culprit was the wine  it usually is. I m not sure of the intelligence level of your shelf fillers but I can tell you this isn t the first time it has happened. I felt cheated and annoyed as I left the store and I also  more importantly  didn t feel valued as a customer. In fact I felt as if my honesty had been doubted too. Perhaps  instead of encouraging your staff to wear amusing Hallowe en costumes you could teach them a bit more about customer service and courtesy though to be honest more staff would be more of a help. The poor witch was manning the Customer Service desk alone. I ve sent this as a message with till receipts attached............in case you doubt me.
Hi I am having problems trying to place a 3 for 2 toy order  can someone please contact me

I have recently moved to Woburn Sands where I now receive my delivery from the Kingston store in MK. Having had a multitude of delivery from the Leighton buzzard branch with little or no problems for years. Since moving and having possibly approx 8 deliveries so far they have been consistently late texting me later times I have had numerous items missing. On one delivery my husband found glass in one of the bags. This is now becoming a joke Tescos. Today I have arrangements and need to leave at 11.20am hence I arranged a slot of 10-11am and yet again you cannot commit. I requested a call back from the store last time it happened and I am still awaiting. This is the last time now I spend thousands with you and if the Kingston store in Milton Keynes cannot cope then don t offer it or better still see how the Leighton buzzard branch do it. The store is a disgrace. !!!!!

Tesco Arena Coventry - My husband has been parking his scooter in the same spot for years with no problems.  He came back to it the other morning after popping in to get some items for lunch at work and found a parking charge notice for ¬£100 stuck to it.  We watched the Arena store being built as we live about a 7 minute wall from Tesco s doors.  We as a family have used this store for our weekly shopping  our petrol and as a  corner store  as we live so close to it and can use it when we need one-off or essential items at various times of the day/night. Although it is a very large shop  because we use it so often we get to know some of the staff and value that personal welcome that you miss in some of the larger stores. However  to now be  fined  for parking his scooter where he has parked for years (and not in anyones way) is just a kick in the teeth from Tesco Management.  Tesco Management must value the income from these car parking companies but this ticket was unfair as my husband parked near to some support pillars (but out of everyone s way so as not to cause an obstruction) to protect his scooter from the car drivers who reverse into your motorbike or scooter and then drive off. Believe me it happens! I am so sad that it has come to this from a shop we enjoyed using.

Just got my grocery delivery   I had ordered a blonde hair dye needed for tonight and my substitute is JET BLACK!!! üò° even the driver was gobsmacked at this. The incompetence of some of your pickers is beyond belief sometimes  they need re-educating. I now have to go out to get the correct colour even though I have university work to be getting on with.

Really disappointed with Tesco today! Over the weekend I planned to buy some toys for Xmas in your 3 for 2 sale. Well what do you know.....it s not really a 3 for 2 sale when buying online is it? It only works on certain toys that are supplied directly from tesco not ALL toys like you say. Out of 6 items I put in my basket only 2 were included in the offer. Couldn t phone over the weekend as tesco direct line isn t operated then. Well tesco  I m taking my ¬£200 I was going to spend on your offer and giving it to toyrus for their sale. Tesco    I have recently moved in with my grandmother who suffers from limited mobility in order to help her with tasks she is unable to complete alone.   We have visited Tesco on multiple occasions (2 different local stores) in the past weeks and to describe the trip as frustrating would be an understatement. My grandmother uses a wheelchair  which I push around. Accordingly  we use the adapted trolleys available at your stores which attach to the wheelchair. The problem does not lie in attaching the trolley to the wheelchair but in maneuvering the trolley around the store.  Whenever we attempt to reverse the trolley the wheels hit the front of the wheelchair or my grandmothers foot/ankle. After this it is a nightmare to free the wheel of the trolley which becomes stuck and immobile behind the front of the wheelchair. During our most recent visit  we had to ask for the help of an employee who could do nothing more than kick the wheel of the trolley until it became free and mobile again. In addition  on the same trip we became stuck in front of the checkouts and a fellow shopper had to help us free the wheel. Sometimes we can be stuck in this position for many minutes and not only does it delay us but it can also be embarrassing. This is especially so for my grandmother who is trying to regain mobility and does not wish to draw attention to herself in the wheelchair as it is  despite the fact that I am constantly reminding her in the modern world there should be no accessibility problems.  I am sure we cannot be the only people who are inconvenienced in such a manner and  if we are honest  it puts us off returning to your stores despite the fact that my grandmother has been a clubcard holder for years.

Really disappointed at your frozen free from range ! Your frozen free from tasted great before you decided to start using gram flour (derived from chick pea) in the majority of items  my child is severely anaphylaxis to wheat gluten egg nuts lentils pulses plus many other foods and fruits ...after discovering sainsbury (a few weeks ago)  had decided to change ingredients and started using gram flour in everything (which meant a whole range from one supermarket was no longer available) I started double checking all the regular bits we brought from your stores (feeling relieved and a happy 12yr old still be able to eat a few bits from your range) only to discover that Tesco had followed the herd and joined the gram flour bandwagon..I now have a miserable 12yr old that now cannot have anything from your supermarket either!! My 12 yr old says  please stop using gram flour and while I m moaning egg too in your freefrom...I have real allergies and while your concentrating on coeliacs and the range got really big recently ...you have completely forgotten about those of us with mulitple anaphylaxis allergies . So while your increasing your range for some your completely letting down others ...I walk in a supermarket and get nothing ...maybe you should try it and see whether your decisions are so great ...thank you for taking away what little food enjoyment I got Tesco!

I m a bit disappointed with Tesco today  or rather my son was very upset.  We popped in to Tesco to see if we could spot a nice Christmas present for my daughter  and we did.  Two nice presents in fact.  And a fantastic looking Hot Wheels Advent calendar.  I agreed to get it  as it was part of the 3 for 2 offer on toys.  Unfortunately the Take n Play Thomas set wouldn t scan on our scanner  so when we got to the checkout we pressed the button to ask for assistance.  The assistance we got was very limited.  We were told that as the item didn t scan  then they couldn t sell it to us  but he did call over another assistant to try and help us.  The second assistant said exactly the same as the first  and the toy was taken away and put in a trolley with other items that were destined to go back on the shelves (I hope it wasn t put back on the shelf to disappoint another small child).  I explained to the assistant that we were getting three toys because of the 3 for 2 offer and asked what he could do to help us in this situation.  He repeated that he couldn t sell me the item  as it didn t scan in  and then wandered off to help another shopper. In the end we left without any of the toys  much to the disappointment of my five year old. There was no offer to try and help resolve things  just an insistence that I couldn t be sold the item.  Having worked in retail  I know that it is perfectly possible to resolve a situation like this to everyone s satisfaction. Please can you double check that items scan  before they go on the shelf  so that you don t get any more upset children who had been looking forward to getting their sister a lovely Christmas present.

Just wanted to tell you how lovely your staff are at the Tesco in London road  north end on the corner of montague road. My 3 year old son was bursting for the toilet and I d said he d have to hold on when a young lady (she had pink hair!) offered for us to use the toilet in the shop without us even asking. She took us through the back and even the staff back there working were so friendly to my son. Brilliant customer service. I hope you will thank your staff working that evening üòä

I just wanted to say a huge thank you to Tescos on behalf of my children  both of whom have food intolerances. My son in particular is tricky  being intolerant to wheat  dairy  soya and sesame (so far!) and our food journey with him has been a real challenge. We have shopped with you for years and have watched your free-from selection grow and develop which has helped us enormously. Recently I tweeted your customer services team wondering if there was any chance you could start stocking a particular brand of coconut yoghurts that we had only been able to find at an online rival that were the only brand our son liked as they weren t solid and very rich like other coconut yoghurts. For a child the other brands are too much to take  whereas one we found was more like regular yoghurts in consistency and flavour and he loved them. Jake from the team replied promptly and said he had logged it on the internal system so hopefully they d consider it. I walked into Tescos on Winwick Road in Warrington yesterday (which already has a fab selection for us) to find the fridge free-from selection massively expanded and the yoghurts I had requested sat on the shelf! Was absolutely over the moon  bought a tonne of them amongst other interesting new things we found in the section and had a very happy baby! Thank you so much for listening to your customers and making our lives as parents so much easier. And thank you from our happy children who can enjoy the same things as their friends.

Today my wee one is super happy because she got a pumpkin to take home  a sweetie in her pocket  she had an apple and a juice while fair talking away to anne and colouring in her pumpkin. She definitely made my trip to tesco today a successful one with no temper tantrums from my wee one  well done and thankyou anne!

having spent w days with Tesco and Apple trying to get my iPad of 2 yrs repaired I have finally solved the problem on my own.  My HOME switch was broken  Apple did not want to know they just wanted to sell off their discontinued range at by saying they do not undertake repairs of iPads.  Tesco wouldnt accept any responsibility for selling it as they insist on a Repair Report from Apple and only Apple which they know customers cannot get.  But you can actually access the HOME button by switching on the iPad and after a few tweaks the HOME buttom becomes a screen button.  So upshot is iPad back woking correctly with no thanks to either TESCO or APPLE

Dear Tesco. Please explain to me how it is that I am being told by my local store that all the things I am looking to buy are no longer available  or out of stock. OK Tesco I m sick of this lousy service off you now.....  Diverted my journey home thru Stone Cross in West Bromwich at 5.30pm tea-time  on my way back from work  to fill up with petrol & get some groceries from the shop at the Tesco Express there.  I did attempt to do exactly the same LAST night but there was a delivery van there (...brilliant timing!) & so it was coned off & shut. Have a guess what? 5.30pm Friday night rush-hour & there s yet ANOTHER delivery van there!!! (...more perfect timing!) & so it was coned off & shut yet AGAIN!! >.< This petrol station with shop has been my weekly regular for a long time - but just lately I m lucky to catch the bloody place OPEN on my way back from work at around 5.30 - it happened to me LAST week as well! >.< WHY can t you receive your deliveries at a quieter time in the day?? Say 10.30am  or just after lunch? OK Tesco - so you ve wasted my time TWICE this week  but you re not gonna waste it AGAIN! - I pass a Shell petrol station with grocery shop earlier on in my journey & there s a Jet station & shop a bit further past my home - so I will  from now on  be taking my wallet & my custom ELSEWHERE!!! #Boycotted!

I asked my son if he would kindly pick me up a bottle of wine from your Burnley branch whilst he was in town (he s 19) so was expecting to be asked for ID but for there to be no problems upon production of this  especially as he had bought a box of Budweiser this morning with his girlfriend. I preferred hooch  diamond white and castaway you know get proper hammered on alcohol with more sugar and E numbers than woolies pick n mix  a modicum of common sense would surly prevail at this point but no!!!  Upon returning to the store after his girlfriend getting a bus home he was again refused and flanked by 2 security guards he subsequently asked to speak to a manager. Now your Burnley store is a large store but apparently only has 1 manager on shift who took 10mins to grace him with his presence  I was on the phone during this conversation he was rather rude and maybe needs a refresher course on customer service and staff rotation as clearly one manager isn t enough poor man had had to leave his tea bless!!

Gosport Tesco Express (Rowner) continue to lead the way in Disability Awareness. The staff at this store know my son has additional needs and every time we go here they offer customer service that can t be faulted. Today approx 1345 we went to the store (I forgot to get a receipt but it was very quiet so it wouldn t be hard to track down the staff member that excelled herself today) and the self service check out was card only we were paying cash.. My son love s to scan the shopping and the lady that served us today asked my son if he would like to scan the items. To your average customer with children additional needs or not this makes shopping fun for children and give ;s them a sense of achievement. The shop was quiet and the lady asked my son if he would like to scan the items which she didn t have to do and the lady knew my son wouldn t say yes please or thank you as he has select mutism (he will only talk to my immediate family). I did thank the lady for such a lovely gesture  I just wanted Head Office to know about the shining stars of Tesco Express Rowner Gosport as this isn t the 1st time I have contacted you about the staff of this store and the support they have given to us.

I went into Tesco today and just inside the door they had the scary veg stand  5 items for 30p. They had carrots and Parsnips. so I chose 3 deformed parsnips and 2 three legged carrots. I put them in a veg/fruit see through bag because they didn t have any dedicated bags for them and when I had finished my shopping went to the checkout. The checkout assistant took them out of the bag and weighed the parsnips at full price and then the carrots. so I said  no they are scary veg.  what?  so I repeated it. she looked at me in that  should I call Security  way. So I quickly explained that Tesco was selling what they called scary veg at 30p per 5 items and it said so on the stand. She knew nothing about it and called a supervisor who also knew nothing about it. They eventually let me have my 5 items for 30p but it made me feel really uncomfortable. Even my husband said to just leave it  it wasnt worth the hassle. You would think that Tesco would tell their staff what they were doing. I m just surprised kids haven t been arrested for eating the free fruit on offer on the same stand.

I visited Tesco Cefn Mawr  (Wrexham) today and just wanted to say a big thank you to the lady (I think her name was Sue) and Mark (again I think that was his name) supervisor for making my little boys day!!! We were shopping for birthday things as he is 8 tomorrow and the checkout lady made a fuss of his birthday  she then asked him about his thick lip which Oscar( my son) told her he d bite it whilst it was numb from a visit to the dentist yesterday. Upon this she asked the supervisor if they could do something for Oscar!!! So off Oscar went with the supervisor to pick a toy!!! I can not explain how grateful we and Oscar were!!! What fantastic service and how heartwarming it made me feel I actually could of cried. People are too quick to complain or take to social media when things go wrong or are not quite right but no one speaks out when good things are done. This was beyond first class service. Thank you so much you ve made one little boys day and have made my day too. Apolggise if i have got your names complety wrong. Again thank you so much xxxxx

Does Tesco from time to time check out the status of whether the Government would consider allowing raw milk products to be sold from a supermarket?       Currently people can buy directly from the FARM and raw milk is not dangerous as many people like to think it has stringent production and regular visits from the authorities to make sure standards of hygiene and production are kept high and to the standard required.  Raw milk is a superior product to pasteurised and in fact a health product  but pasteurisations damages the protein in milk and actually makes it a non health product.

I just wanted to share something wonderful with you. Today I visited my local store in Whiteley with my daughter who was celebrating her 15th birthday. We came to pick up a cake for her. She was wearing a birthday badge and when we arrived in store we were greeted by the most wonderful man Ola.  He wished her happy birthday and sang to her then later on as we were leaving to go home he did something truly amazing. He gave her a card and some chocolates and spoke to her about her dreams for the future and that she can achieve anything she sets her mind too if her heart desires. Now Ola didn t know that my daughter has additional needs and he didn t know that she s been struggling with life recently and what decisions to make for the future. But after her chat with your wonderful member of staff she told me that she felt better about her future and she smiled and laughed the rest of the day. A simple act of pure kindness has done so much and I don t know how I can thank this guy enough for what he did today. He is truly one of life s special gems and he needs to be recognised for this. Please give him a big pat on the back Tesco he so deserves it.  Signed One very happy Mummy :) ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

We do an online shop with you every week with no problems. Yesterday our shopping was due to arrive between 8 and 9. I book it for this time as the baby is in bed but as he is a terrible sleeper and my day usually begins at 4am I am normally in bed no later than 9. If you are a parent  especially one with a poor sleeper  you will understand how precious time and sleep are. Yesterday you text to say our shopping would be late. We needed the shopping yes  but I had just survived 3 nights on the trot with absolutely no sleep.  I m not really complaining that you were late  stuff happens  problems are unavoidable. But in that moment I just wanted to tell you not to come.  I had no choice however as despite the fact you could contact me I had no way of responding to your texts.  Eventually the shopping arrived at 9.50.  My feedback would be this: if you can t make the time I ve booked please let me cancel. If this was a day time slot we may not have been in if you were late. I d rather be given the choice given I have paid for a delivery time.

I have just been to my local Heath Hayes store to purchase some seabrook crisps for my coeliac daughter (guaranteed gluten free crisps)  as I was not able to locate them in the normal position  I approached a member of staff to ask why/where the crisps were. Two members of staff then checked the stock room   and advised that this particular store are no longer stocking them  but was told I could make a request at customer services to try and get them back in. I spoke to customer services who located the manager  who proceeded to tell me that this store will no longer be stocking the requested brand of crisps as they are not making enough money on this particular brand.  Clearly it all comes down to profits instead of catering for every individuals needs  this is complete discrimination. This is not the first time I have contacted Tescos to complain or make a request for gluten free foods to be available. Sadly Tescos you have lost a customer after 20+ years of shopping with you  and I will be making the fact profits come before needs to all the gluten free /coeliac groups available.

I received a response that starts with  I can appreciate how concerning this may have been for you   well frankly I m not at all sure you do appreciate that at all  since my 2 year old niece was with me for dinner that Sunday and had a piece of strudel too...I suppose I should be grateful that it was me that bit down on it and the only outcome was that no one wanted to eat any more and it all went in the bin  rather than her choking on it and a potentially awful conversation with my sister. Iwonder if anyone else has had a problem with TESCO Help Desk.  I purchased an iPad 2 yrs ago - the Home button broke so I took it back and said that I would have expected a more robust manufacture of a key component and that 2yrs is not Fit and Proper.  I was advised by the young man  in a very aggressive tone  that I was using the incorrect terminology and that when purchased the item was Fit for Purpose.  He would advise what he needed to help me further.  Did I have till receipt: no but I have the Interest Free Credit Agreement.  Thats no good - Did I have proof of purchase like bank statement - well yes.  Could he have the last 4 digits of the DD.  No I didnt have it with me - to this he said - again aggressively - but you told me you did.  No I didnt say with me didnt think I would need all that.  Then he said he would need a full written Repair Report from Apple.  I had already explained that I had been through to Apple Help and their advice was that they do not repair iPads merely recycle but would exchange mine for a like for like at a cost of ¬£180.  I reminded the young man of this and he said that in order for him to help he had to have a repair report from Apple.  So the upshot of this story is that where Apple and TESCO are concerned you dont really have any recourse for complaint.  TESCO have now lost one loyal customer - disgusted

Hi Tesco   I m wondering whether you guys on here can help.  My mum is a regular user of your Callington store and often has my little brother  who is 12  with her.  She has mentioned to me that the store intends to employ parking attendants to patrol the car park. Part of the rules they will enforce is that in order to use the parent and child parking area she will have to be issued with a  ticket or badge  to be displayed when parked in a bay - it s a fantastic idea as these are commonly used by people without children and can only be used until the children are 12 years old.  Usually this would be perfectly acceptable  however my brother is autistic. He quite often forgets where he is and the kind of safety advice that most of us follow without a second thought - such as not running into the road without looking.  Not to mention should a melt-down happen. He will either walk or run away  sometimes with his eyes closed.  As he is fully mobile  he isn t entitled to a disabled parking badge.  As you can imagine  the parent and child parking area is a great help to my mum and brother  especially as 99% of the time she is on her own with him.   I was wondering whether you knew if there was a way we could get a permit for my brother despite the age-related rules  or whether this will be a blanket age limit with no exceptions?   Thank you for your time :)

I just wanted to write on here to allow people to know how unreliable Tesco direct delivery/Order service. I purchase a lot of products from Tesco and Tesco direct and have recommended it to a lot of my friends and family.   Unfortunately I will no longer be using Tesco services as I have received some bad service the last few times of using them.   Few months back I ordered a laptop through Tesco as I needed one urgently and they promised me that if I order before 3pm I can collect from my local store the next day. I was let down by this as the laptop didn t arrive and I had to wait for a week to get the laptop. They gave me ¬£6 compensation. Which I guess is something.   I decided to still shop with them. I wanted to order a iPhone 7 sim free this week as it s 20% off for staff and my dad works for them. They didn t have the 128gb black in stock so I spent a little more money and purchased the 256gb black one. As it said it was in stock. I went through with the transaction  they took my money within minutes. I then purchased a new SIM card with my network and bought the case for the new phone etc. The next day I receive a email from Tesco direct saying that they made a mistake and that I will not be getting the phone and will be refunded.   I am extremely disappointed as this is the second time of being let down by Tesco. Also they have now got my money in which I won t receive for 3-5 working days. Meaning I can t even purchase a phone from somewhere else as I don t have the funds to do so.   When calling them. They had not offered me anything in compensation seeing as it is their mistake in the first place.  I feel as if Tesco has purposely taken the stock off there website due to the 20% discount. When I check the day night before 20% started they were all available. Yet within the night they had all gone.   I feel as if as it s Tesco fault that they should allow me to purchase the phone at the price it is when I went through with the transaction. As it clearly was in stock otherwise it wouldn t have completed the transaction and taken my money so fast.   I will be making a formal complaint if the matter isn t resolved

Once again I find myself thanking and praising Tesco extra in Maldon. After my little girl had an accident falling out of a trolley and really hurting her face and head  the staff couldn t do anymore for us! I also had my newborn baby with me who needed feeding and he was provided for with hot water to heat his milk  plus a couple of spare bottles to take to hospital. An ambulance was called for my daughter straight away by a first aider  she was given a toy to distract her while being checked over  we were sectioned off for privacy with some screens and proceeded with chairs  my shopping was scanned and packed for us and dealt with  even the baby had a lovely time being held by various members or staff while I attended to my little girl. Thank you all so much  it was dealt with quickly and professionally and everyone involved deserves recognition for being so great  and a Christmas bonus üòÅ Aimee Healy  Erynn Healy  Ashley Healy and Jenny Pope (my Nan who was also with us) x

What a total joke the three values put up by Tesco No one tries harder for customers is the first laugh ! My experience of buying a PC online which after 14months is unrepairable and being offered less than half its value does not feel like trying hard ! Being told that the matrix applied makes it uneconomical (for Tesco ) to give me anything approaching the refund I should be or replace it . SO BEWARE if you buy a PC from Tesco don t expect it to last more than 2years. Don t expect customer service just expect to be fobbed off. We treat people how they want to be treated . Joke number 2 I have made countless phone calls to get nowhere. No one listens just repeat policy as if it s a solution for me !! Customers want outcomes not to know why Tesco do what they do. It must have taken much more time and trouble to deal with this stupid situation in a prolonged manner than it would have cost to sort it fairly. I am getting Barclaycard to contest it and liaising with Consumer Rights . I will keep going until I get some justice but NO this is NOT how I want to be treated . When something goes wrong I want ownership of the problem and swift restitution. I am the one who has had no PC for months . My last one incidentally from Curry s lasted 10years !!! DONT buy from Tesco I won t because every little doesn t help me ! I can t do anything with the peanuts you are offering me back. You try to take every little you can from people. It will cost you what you make out of selling me a substandard product and refusing to put things right as I will not shop in Tesco at all because of this Food clothes anything . Not that you care !! Rant over for today .

Tesco s Mexican Chilli Bean Soup has changed. I m afraid it s not very good change. Hi Tesco   I m a coeliac and until recently took advantage of excellent provision at my local store in Yeovil.   However I m really unhappy at the tendency of this store to remove popular selling products; such as Udi s Tiger Loaf as an example. They are then replaced with Tesco s own version of free from breads and products.  Due to levels of sensitivity and variance  many coeliac and gluten free people find a brand or make of bread that suits them and stick to it. This isn t easily reproduced by another manufacturer  particularly a non specialist branching out into perhaps a lucrative but incredibly nuanced area. Some of us react or experience adverse reactions to certain types of gluten free products  for some reason  and we learn what works.   It s particularly galling when it is a popular product that is then phased out and remains unstocked - only to be replaced by an alternative supermarket version and to take away consumer choice by not stocking the original.   Please can you address this insidious policy of replacing reputable gluten free food manufacturers with own brand free from products- or at least stock both so that consumers are given the best choice. At least then your customers are still purchasing from you. Currently  even though I am about two minutes away from our Tesco Extra  I will now be taking my custom elsewhere due to the fact your bread is unsuitable for my needs.   Many Thanks.   #coeliacuk #udi #coeliac #glutenfree #freefrom

Hello  When I was a child in the 80 s and 90 s I was taught to respect my elders. We used to grow hyacinth and make shoe boxes full of festive cheer and staples to help when the need for heating was stronger than the need for food.  Now as an adult I would like to continue this age old tradition and I am now looking for some help to give as many elderly people in my local area a little bit of ease and maybe for a minute forget the worry of food and heating costs. Would you be willing to support my cause and be able to pledge some help towards the people who grew us and our country and now need us to make their lives just that little bit easier.

Hullo Tesco  was in the Camelon store today. Got the 6 hot dog rolls for 65p. Paid for them at the self scanners  lifted the bag (didn t have a carrier) and the 6 rolls bombed out onto the floor. Apologised and the nice lassie there to help said I could collect another pack. Thanks very much to her by the way  appreciated that. Collected another packet and headed home  only to realise one of the rolls was brick hard as that packet was already burst. Going by how hard the roll was  it had been burst for some time. The Tesco packaging on loaves and rolls is much too thin I think  so easy to burst open. Shame  because the Tesco bakery is great.

Today I visited my local Tesco (Sheffield Abbeydale road) I usually would head to Waitrose however my best friend was driving and it s a terrifying experience so therefore as little time as possible in the car is needed after purchasing some delicate gin close to yours at Majestic Wines we headed to you for some snacks and beverages to accompany it - not forgetting the ice.  Upon looking for mozzarella dippers in almost every aisle we found ourselves amongst your frozen goods - we met John next to the party food - he was dressed in his Tesco uniform and his trolley had approximately 48 beers in! I proceeded to ask John. John looked approachable like he would a man that you could rely on for your food needs....  Excuse me please  but where would I find your mozzarella dippers.  I directed at John with a huge smile his reply.  I have no idea.  To which he proceeded to walk off in the opposite direction.  I looked at my driving companion scared that we may have to head further in her car to find our mozzarella dippers. She returned my look and we proceeded to head back to the chilled section. I looked at my designated driver and told her  it s ok  John had probably finished work and was heading to a party with all that beer.  We returned to the chilled section where (I may get this wrong) Kazlick was sorting the 2 mains 2 sides for ¬£6 section. I approached him on my hunt.  Excuse me  do you sell mozzarella dippers  Mmmm his reply  mozzarella dippers?  He walked off and I followed. He approached his colleague who s name I did not catch but before he could ask after my mozzarella dippers this man proceeded to shout at him about not putting the 2 pint of semi skimmed milk on the shelves - poor Kazlick was only trying to help me - he finally got chance to ask and they were pointed out to me by shouty milk man - not a smile on site. At this point my friend found me she has also found alternative mozzarella dippers for the same price but in different packaging on the chilled section we were puzzled but we thanked Kazlick and went to pay. Upon paying - our service with a smile continued to be non existent. As we were leaving we realised we had forgotten the limes - so I headed to the fruit section to which both members of staff on said section were too busy flirting to direct me to where they were so I found them myself. The only person who redeemed this terrible shopping experience was the man on customer services who was friendly  approachable and all that a person in retail should be. Whilst paying I noticed John having a good old chat with the security card so my thoughts about him finishing work were quickly dismissed and he obviously just isn t very good at his job. Overall my visit to Tesco today was disappointing.  I would probably give it a 4/10 and that s being nice. We are eating said mozzarella dippers right now and I must say I just wish I had held the handle in the car and let me friend take us a little bit further to Waitrose.  This taught me to trust my friend and not men called John who work at Tesco. In this case every little didn t help In fact John was helpless.

Yesterday i went to store2995. to the pharmacy with a prescription. I and another person waited 10 minutes for attention while staff stood behind the screen. Dear tesco. I would like to thank the staff in your Flitwick  Bedfordshire store for being not only extremely helpful but going above and beyond the call of duty today. So I went into Tesco the other day. Bought a few bits  6 things actually. Went to the self services till to pay. The screen was on the usual  home  screen where it said start. There was also a bit that said cards only  no coins or cash or something similar. This wasn t a problem as I was using my card any way.  I scanned my first item  a cake that was ¬£2.65. I put it in the bag and as I went to get item No. 2 to scan  I noticed the screen showed my one item at ¬£2.65 but the total at the bottom of the screen was ¬£5.25.  I Calle dyne assistant over. She looked puzzled. Suggested we cancel the transaction and start again. This now worked fine.  I asked her how this happened. Her answer was that the person before me had moved tills! But there were no other items listed  otherwise I would have noticed them.  She said oh it does it sometimes. It would be ok any way as you could get your money back from customer services. Oh that s ok the.  Assuming of course I realised the total was wrong or checked my receipt.  So how often does this happen? How often does a shopper unknowingly pay for something they haven t had? Would some older or with a learning disability be expected to notice? Not saying they wouldn t notice but it would be harder.  Extra few quid. Multiplied  by how many people  how many stores?  Every little helps!

Whilst I appreciate the thought of  bringing back  the milkfloat to the community  I would like to take this opportunity to remind you of why it s called a float.   The milkfloat goes round at an ungodly hour (5.18am past my house) and in an effort to not annoy and awake every living being on its round the providers of this amazing service worked out almost 80 years ago that a quiet float is better. To that end they invented the electric milk float  which was eerily silent and  floated  around its rounds delivering it s goods and making breakfast a happy time for millions of people across this fair land.   So my question would be  why do you choose to use an old rattly transit van that sounds like an earthquake moving down the street  and with the frequent stops I get to listen it idling a few times down my street as it wakes up the sparrows. I can assure you it needs a service  or quite possibly just scrapping completely.   Whilst I appreciate it may not sound too loud during daylight hours   imagine the dead of night silence in a quiet residential area being completely and utterly shattered by what I actually thought for the first few times was an articulated lorry.   Do you have any plans to replace the cursed vehicle that wakes me every morning without fail  or should I invest in some heavy duty earplugs?    This would have been a wittier message  but the truth is I am exhausted.  Tidworth  Wiltshire.

Would just like to say a HUGE thank you  I am a regular customer at the local Tesco and the staff are very helpful and friendly due to my disabilities I sometimes have seizures and/or dislocations in the store and  feel the staff do their best to make sure I m safe and recover as soon as possible and always reassure me. One particular time I felt a seizure coming on and in panic I notified a member of the security team who was nearby and he helped me out of my wheelchair and onto the floor   and phoned for an ambulance and stayed with me and when I came round he was very reassuring and helpful  another occasion I was sat in the cafe and I felt fine but a member of the security team was walking by and actually noticed the warning signs before I did ! He calmly advised me to lie on the floor and minutes later I was in a seizure which in my opinion and experience goes well above and beyond what is expected. I would definitely say that Tesco are good with people who have disabilities as sometimes I m in my chair and struggle to reach something off a shelf and if a member of staff is passing by they will often pick the item off the shelf for me .Thank you :)

I booked appointment with an optician at Tesco in Hampton for my little girl. She felt very nervous about getting her eyes tested  we spoke about it over and over again at the weekend  trying to reassure that there is nothing to worry about. We also watched kids friendly video about the visit to optitian to ease the worries  however she started to cry uncontrollably every time we mentioned it.  When we arrived at Tesco  she hid around the corner and refused to coorporate. She was very upset and could not overcome the fear. I informed one of the member of staff ( Michelle) about the possibility that we might need to cancel our appointment. Michelle was very understanding and told us to take as much time as needed. While I was trying convince my little girl  Michelle came around the corner with a sticker and started to have a friendly chat. They both agreed to book another appointment in a weeks time. As a parent I felt so grateful and even amazed of such  friendly and understanding approach. Michelle booked new appointmen after checking a diary to make sure  her friend  will be there to meet us. She also describe her friend ( colleague) to my little girl. Additionally she offered her to see both rooms that she will need to visit on the day of her appointment. My little girl replied that she will possibly do it next time. Michelle understood that it is important for a child to feel familiar with the setting  changed her offer saying- ok  can I show mummy then? You can also come with us. She happily agreed. Michelle was very positive and friendly towards us and even allowed to test the equipment. I can not express  how much I appreciate Michelles amazing skills and kindness. My daughter was just another customer in Michelles busy day but for my daughter it changed the whole day and I believed made her a better person by showing how a complete stranger can care and support someone who is feeling scared or upset. She skipped around the shop and mentioned the lovely lady in Tesco opticians. My little girl cant wait to see Michelle s friend and get her eyes tested next week. Thank you for such a positive experience!

Tesco  I m really disappointed in you!  I chose to use your music download service a year or so ago  on the basis that you were competitive on price and that your name meant that you would be a safe bet for the future. I was wrong.  Obviously the main selling point for using a music download service over buying CD s is that it acts as a backup if you should ever lose your music from your computer.  Well  the inevitable happened and my hard drive died  causing me to lose a large amount of music collected over the years. No  problem  I thought  I can always download it again from the various service providers that I have used. Luckily much of this was through Amazon  where I have had no problem in downloading my purchases.  When I came to get the music that I had bought through Tesco though  I found that the service no longer existed. I contacted you by email to ask what alternatives were in place to access the service I had paid for  only to be told that there were none! I was also told that you had emailed all your customers telling them that the service was being withdrawn. Well  I happen to have an email service where no emails are deleted. I went back through them and found no such emails. I am sure that if I d had an email telling  me that a service I had paid for was being withdrawn I d have been having this conversation with you then.  I am left feeling that Tesco s has ripped me off  taking a not inconsiderable amount of money for a service which  at the point of needing it  was not there.

Dear Tesco   Today I visited your Kings Cross express store and was simultaneously both confused and appalled.   Whist paying for my shopping at the self-service check-out the man next to me was just paying for his daily shopping and lunchtime meal deal. He promptly paid and left without looking back to notice he had left his lunch at the check out.   One of your members of staff came over to pick-up the abandoned lunch items and checked to see if he could see the customer who had already left. Following this  to my utter confusion  he threw the items into the trash.   As I witnessed this  confused by the utter wastefulness  I looked out of the window to see the homeless man who I pass outside your store every day salvaging through the bin for scraps of food - what a messed up world we live in!   As I m sure you re aware  homelessness is a real and devastating issue both across London and UK. Charities like Shelter are working tirelessly to try and provide maximum support with little to no funding.   Please re-think the way you contribute to the societies in which you locate your stores

So here s a scenario;  Sister orders a ¬£33 Lego set for our cousins birthday this weekend. Hi guys. :-)  Totally unrelated to my other concurrent about pricing and price-match guarantees. I ve been having a much needed sort out and filing session over the past weekend to try and have a post-summer tidy up. This included filing a few Clubcard statements that had been sat on the post table for the past year(!) or so  so I only noticed this niggle today.      When doing Clubcard statements/mailings that the customer might be inclined to file or archive in some way  please can you *avoid* the use of glue-spots or strips anywhere on the mailing itself? These have a nasty tendancy to be impossible to remove from the mailing without prior knowlege of how to do this (Normally requiring a heat gun or hairdryer and a lot of patience) and tend to cause statements to stick to other documents  which makes filing a complete pig. :-o      If the use of glue could be restricted to the flap of the mailing alone (As used to be the case) this would be far better and much appreciated by many customers  especially as a gluey flap on its own is much easier to remove and dispose of separately.      Many thanks in advance for following the above recommendation. :-)

I want to share my experience today at Tesco Store. My Husband and I have been doing a happy shopping at Tesco super store in Tottenham Hale (seven sisters) for the last 5 years. We explain her that we have been doing the same shopping  for the last 5 years and no one has requested such a thing before. With have of our groceries already checked  he stopped the machine with the argument that our shopping was to big. They didn t even let us to finish or listen to us  just tell us to move! Was a very embarrassing and humiliating! that never happened in the 5 years we have been shopping there! We were so disappointed and thinking in no coming back to that store...

Last Sunday whilst shopping at your Meadows store in Sandhurst I slipped on a grape whilst holding my nine-month-old son. He hit his head on the floor very badly and we had to rush to A&E. The staff we spoke to at the time were helpful but we could not give full details of the accident as clearly we needed to leave straightaway. We did however leave our contact details and we re told that someone would call to check on us later in the week. To date we have heard nothing  which I assume means the incident has not even been reported. We re concerned that this is an accident which has not been recorded in an appropriate manner  and wouldn t want any other parent tot go through the anguish that we had last week.

Not inpressed that there seems no longer to be any fallback for when chip and pin doesn t work - as happened with my card today.  The card may be faulty but it worked less than an hour before in a petrol station chip and pin.  The customer service guy gave me some line about how if you use swipe and sign instead it s open to fraud but I can t imagine many people keep a deliberately broken chip card especially so they can sign for purchases and then immediately withdraw all the money - since you only use swipe as a backup.  Swipe and sign (and even taking an impression of the card) are still valid backup systems.  If the chip and pin goes down store-wide are you going to only trade in cash and turn away all the other customers?  I bet not.

Dear Tesco   A few minutes ago I took delivery of my latest shop. All arrived and in good order  I noticed that carrier bags were used despite me accepting not to. Then I found out why. There had been a spate of safety issues raised  mainly about entering customers  houses and that the  van-to-fridge  delivery may not always be guaranteed.  Whether this is a local issue or a nationwide issue I do not know  but the point I would like to raise is that I am a disabled person with mobility problems and rely on your delivery person to bring my weekly shopping to my kitchen. Take that away I will have no choice but to find another supplier.  KInd regards   Hazel Brewer  PS In my last job I did a stint as Safety Officer. I have noticed over the years that some of your delivery personnel double up/treble up the loads to save the number of trips from the van to indoors. Perhaps you can incorporate carrying manageable loads in your next team brief?

Dear Tesco   I am very very cross. So cross in fact I may throw a princess sized tantrum. However  this is an impossibility. Why I hear you ask? I have no wand!  I bought myself a Glow heart wand from your store in anticipation of being the glowiest princess at the party. Great idea right? Not so. You see I also bought two more Glow wands so I can have fellow Glow princesses. However  as we handed out the wands amongst ourselves  I had the last one.  We were discussing how they may work their glow magic when disaster struck! My fairy princess glow wand felt like it was in fact missing... the wand!  Alas I have a heart but nowhere to mount it s magic! I haven t yet opened my wand so it may be that mine is the magicest and has an invisibility spell on the wand (quite clever I do say  if this proves to be the case). I am now the grumpiest Princess at the party. Please can you advise how you intend to restore peace to the kingdom and the magic to my wand! :)

I am writing to you to complain about the service I have received from Tesco.  I bought a car DVD player from Tesco and it broke  I took it back and you replaced it for another one. This week the DVD player broke again.  My partner took it to the Aberdeen store on Thursday and explained the situation  the shop assistant phoned your head office and then came back to my partner and said okay we have refunded your money back to your card that you bought the DVD player with.  My partner said that he hadnt wanted a refund he wanted an exchange and also that the card that we had bought this with was no longer the bank that we used  the shop assistant went and called head office again and explained the situation. Head office said that because the card was under my name and not my partners if I called the next day with my new card details that they would get this sorted and paid to the correct card.  I called yesterday to be told that the payment has already been made to my old bank and there is nothing they can do about it. I apparently have to phone my old bank (which I have no details of at all as it s an old bank account and I have no paperwork for it) and try get my money back.  To make matters worse Tesco can t even give me an ANR number (I believe that s the correct name) until Monday maybe Tuesday to even try sort out this mess that Tesco have created.  I now have a very upset daughter as she has no DVD player and we have not been given our money so can t even go out and buy her a new one. I have asked for compensation and apparently even that can t be dealt with as the situation is not resolved. This would not of been a situation if Tesco had asked if we wanted an exchange or a refund rather than just decide we were getting a refund and not give us the chance to say we had changed bank details.  I am very unhappy about this and will be putting this on social media as to how Tesco have treated me.

My husband and I arrived on our  motorbike to fill up at your Plymouth store this morning. I stayed on the bike as I always do  and he got off and began to use the pump. Across the filling station came a very irate store person shouting  you have to get off  you have to get off   when she got to us she repeated  you have to get off the bike   when my husband asked why she said  its legislation its the law you cant fill your bike with a passenger on the back  (I m not a passenger I m a pillion).
