Hi Tesco   Experienced really shoddy service in your Tidworth branch yesterday at your customer service counter (5:45pm). I was waiting to buy stamps. The lady in the queue ahead of me was being served at the till by a Tesco rep but having a personal conversation with a second Tesco rep who was standing at the end of the counter. I waited while the transaction completed. Then waited some more as they continued their personal conversation which was about the second Tesco reps health problems. And waited... Finally the customer ahead of me wrapped up the conversation and left so the counter was free for me approach. I took a step forward....But no. The second  rep said to the one serving that she wanted to put her stuff through the till  so (both still ignoring me) the two members of staff put her items through (2 bottles of hairspray and a packet of sandwiches). This is with the second rep leaning over the end of the counter to pass them to the serving rep. Neither of them even looked at me although it was blatantly obvious I was waiting. I waited a bit more. Finally they completed putting the rep s transaction on  stored  because she wanted to pay for it later. Finally the serving rep looks up at me. No smile  no  sorry for making you wait   nothing. I asked for the stamps. She put the transaction through without saying a word  then handed my my receipt and said  there you go  no thank you  no goodbye. It really p****d me off. Customer service in your stores is usually excellent. These two members of staff are pretty rubbish examples of that. It s not nice to feel like a nuisance for actually trying to buy something. I noted the serving lady s name tag but don t want to post it here.

Phoned customer services (very understanding guy  the only good thing out of all this) who informed me that there had been a bomb scare in a tunnel and they could not reach me. What about phone/email me? You cannot keep customers waiting until midnight with no explanation. Goodbye Tesco  hello Sainsbury. You guys have let me down one time too many with your deliveries

Preston Hackspace are looking for sponsorship from local and national businesses  whether it be a monies or free equipment to kit out the space. We are a non-profit organisation  helping to promote technology and our expertise to the local communities and our members.  In return we advertise your business on our website  facebook page  twitter account  write a blog and put your logo on the wall in our space.  We are looking for the following kit and anything else you can contribute:  - fire extinguishers - electric radiator or heaters - desks and chairs - shelving and cupboards - storage boxes - first kit - power and hand tools  Please contact andrew.wade@prestonhackspace.org.uk if you wish to help. Hi  I just wanted to pass on my thanks to a few ladies in your team at Hewitts Circus Store in Cleethorpes. On Thursday 13th Oct I purchased two newborn pramsuits and when I got home I found one had been displayed on the wrong hanger and was the wrong size. So this morning  Friday 14th  I ve returned to Store to change it for the correct size. While in store I met three ladies from your team in the clothing department (I m sorry  I didn t catch their names) One who checked to see if any of the pramsuits were in the newborn size I wanted. (There wasn t any) Another lady that ordered the pramsuit online for me (I m picking it up tomorrow) and another lady who refunded me. All three of these ladies were so helpful. Now  it might seem like they ve not done anything out of the ordinary and that they re just  doing their job  but when it s 8am  you re heavily pregnant with twins  you re exhausted from lack of sleep  your feet are swollen so you have to waddle everywhere and all you want to do is sit down with some chocolate ~ this service  friendly chat and helpfulness means a lot. So thank you lovely ladies.

Congratulations Tesco on your fantastic customer service....not. After purchasing an American fridge freezer back in July and it being delivered damaged. 2 failed engineer call outs  2 replacements later and damage caused to my property  I am still waiting on getting things resolved. I was told your service level agreement with your supplier was to allow them 28 days to investigate what went wrong and the damage to my property. After patiently waiting I still haven t heard anything from them. Your customer service agent was supposed to call me back today to tell me what happens next  still not happened. I ve been more than patient  it s time you stopped messing around.

So I was in Tesco Warfield in Bracknell today doing the shopping with my 3 year old Jens. Its important I feel  to let you know that I scanned as I shopped.  Long story short  just as I was nearly done Jens asked me to carry him as he was tired. Seconds later he was throwing up on me in the isle  2 shots fired.  Fortunately it seems my hood caught most of it  with the rest running down his jumper and my chest. Fortunately we somehow managed to avoid a spilage..well at least one that would have required a Tannoy announcement.  So i pushed my trolley to the toilet carrying Jens and smelling absoultely revolting. In the loo I bagged my jacket and my tshirt and Jens s jumper  handsoaped my chest  neck and his hands and face.  Thankfully I could quickly pay and be on my way. I walked gracefully and topless to the scan as you shop (SAYS) tills and scanned the barcode to upload my list.   Then I was selected for a random security check....I don t blame you Tesco but I swear to god you check me everytime!  The girl manning the SAYS walked past me with judgemental eyes  obviously not the reaction I would have hoped for when topless but still  i was aware I probably stilled stank of sick. I tried to pass her my scanner in a frenzy and explained  child  sick  me. She was having trouble with another customers security check and she soon walked back to them. Now I dont wanna complain and I know I cant justify queue jumping (or can I?) But she didnt even seem to call for an extra hand. So i stood there topless  smelling of sick waiting to get my kid home for a bath.  Definately not a long story short it seems.  Anyway I m not here to complain  I wanted to thank the gentleman that came and handed me a t-shirt. I was a bit rushed and didnt get a chance to see his name or anything  but he came over handed me a t-shirt and allowed me to gain back some of my dignity. He was wearing a Tesco jacket so I am assuming he wasnt a random handing me clothes to steal...  It was a very small and very kind gesture and I hope you identify him and give him some recognition for it  he is clearly a credit to Tesco for his customer service. Well unless what you take from this is that your staff are giving away clothes...  I was eager to get home and I was dealing with a variety of emotions  this guy made it all that little bit easier.   So thanks Tesco  thanks Tesco employee and sorry to you both if there are any unfrozen chunks in isle 2!

I had a delivery slot booked for between 9pm and 10pm last night. I received a text to say it could be delayed by up to half and hour which was fine. I then received another text message to say it could be up to 11.05pm. With a 5am start this morning that was too late. I called in and explained this to be told they could reschedule to this evening which I was fine with. At 10pm I was just heading to bed when your driver arrived with my shopping  I thought great he has made it. He handed me my shopping apologising for some of it being wet. This was a huge understatement... at least 60% of my shopping was covered in red wine... the driver spotted this and said oh there must have been a breakage on the van ( I hadn t ordered any wine) I then had to stand and wash loads of my shopping  kitchen sides mop my floors and front step. The last thing I wanted to be doing after a long day ... I then discovered the tissues I ordered where unusable so called the call centre this evening after work. I was told that my shopping was still scheduled for this evening?????? I explained I had already had it. He said we ll you asked for it to be rescheduled and that s what they have done so again explained I thought that seeing as they delivered my shopping there was no need for another delivery..? He then advised that I would still have been charged for today s shopping??? I explained that if they have charged me again then I would be left with no money for a week. As a single working mother of four children under 7 every penny counts and I cannot cope without that money. He offered no solution other than to process the refund which will still take 5 days! He said I should have been informed another payment would be taken during my original call as this is how rescheduling works...  this was never explained to me (please listen to the call) as i wasn t  rescheduling out of choice as it was a delay caused by Tesco. I am now left with no money at all and 4 children to provide for... thanks.

lets connect the dots?  here we go: - Monsanto: American multinational agrochemical and agricultural biotechnology company that creates cancer-producing GMO crops worldwide and uses deadly Roundup herbicide and other deadly fertilizers  also destroying otherwise fertile lands. - Unilever- British and Dutch multinational that produces/packages products - mostly using Monsanto crops and deadly concentrated sugars  chemicals artificial flavouring and deadly colourings - including marmite  dove  helmans  knorr  lipton  sunsilk  omo  rexona  etc.  - the British pound has dropped to the floor - so Unilever wants UK supermarkets to increase prices by 10% - major supermarket Tesco has temporarily refused to increase prices - those products are currently scarse or missing from the British supermarket shelves.  Where do WE stand in all this? Maybe this is the opportunity to question if Britain even wants any of all that rubbish anymore. Maybe it s an opportunity to close this picture and People stand up to refuse any more poisoning.  This is not sbout boycotting. There are healthy options out there to knorr cubes  lipton tea and helmans mayonaise etc. Maybe Tesco can start stocking Ethically manufactured  organic certified  GMO-free products.  Many argue these products are more expensive  but then it is an opportunity to buy and eat what we need for our sustenance and health and not have fridges and cupboards overflowing with stuff that expires and winds up in the bin.  We do have choice. Imagine that? How lucky we are to have choice. We can choose for our health and for the planet.

Offended is an understatement I am absolutely livid!! Do you routinely train your checkout staff to accuse customers of theft over their headsets in front of said customer without any cause to?  After visiting your Tring Road  Aylesbury store this evening I found a lovely pair of PJ bottoms in your clearance section - at 6 months pregnant its the little comforts! so whilst my other half went to check the price on a fryer (that was missing the shelf edge label) my 6 year old and I finished our shopping and headed towards the self service checkout. My other half had returned the fryer to the shelf and said how rude the checkout assistant Fozia was claiming she was unable to price check items so would have to take it to another till - Complete rubbish! We continued to the self service checkout and proceeded to scan our items  on scanning the PJ bottoms they came up as ¬£9 instead of the marked sticker ¬£5. ¬£4 difference not a major issue but still a pricing error I called for the assistant and Fozia unfortunately was the one to  assist . She looked at the sale sticker pulled it about and then over her headset loudly claimed that she had a customer at the checkouts who had changed a sale sticker and could someone confirm the price. My blood boiling at this point - being accused of tampering with sale stickers I asked to see the duty manager. Another member of checkouts arrived and exclaimed the till price was correct and again claimed the sticker had obviously been tampered with. I again calmly explained I wanted to see the duty manager  well the DM Tracey? Was apparently unavailable so Alison came over to apologise. Alison repeatedly said how sorry she was however as I m sure you can imagine by this point I wasn t going to continue my purchase purely out of principle! Is it really worth accusing and infuriating a customer over ¬£4?! I m absolutely furious at the complete lack of customer service and inability to handle a complaint in store that I ve had to resort to posting this!

I really hate to do this as I have been a loyal customer of Tesco for many many years... in store and in the last few years on line.... The groceries online has been my life line   I have a very badly disabled son and going shopping is often impossible so I rely on getting the right groceries delivered to my door..... I was disappointed when Tesco stopped the voucher double ups as I saved and used it to buy my sons Christmas present  which has often saved Christmas for us and quite frankly the triple points on days out mean nothing to us as my boy couldn t go to the theme parks etc  but that wasn t enough to make me think about moving to a different supermarket  the minimum spend of ¬£40 was also a bit of a problem as I can t now suddenly decide to get a few extras delivered when I need them when my son it too ill to go out  again I decided to stay loyal and keep going....... BUT..... in the last few months the deliveries themselves have got worse and worse..... the substitutions have become ridiculous..... (cling film instead of the tin foil I ordered)... in the last few deliveries I ve had rotten items  missing items  a whole bag full missing and I now send back more substitutes than I accept..... the customer service team are always polite and will refund when things are wrong immediately but quite frankly when I can almost guarantee there will be items wrong or missing that s no consolation when I then have to go without something I need or make arrangements for someone to sit with my son so I can then go and get them....... I pay for delivery saver but tonight I am having a delivery from Morrisons and over the next few weeks I will try Asda  Sainsbury etc and if they can give better service I feel I will have no option but to cancel it and go elsewhere.... after being a customer for 30 years that saddens me........

I am absolutely disgusted with both Tesco mobile and Tesco insurance and the way they lie to their customers without hesitation. Upon taking my mobile phone contract out I was sold phone insurance. I was advised that I would be covered for loss  damage etc and there would be an excess fee but if there was a fault with the phone there would be no would be no fee. This was the same with a previous provider and so it was never queried and I never checked the small print of the terms and conditions. In hindsight I should never have trusted his word of mouth! My phone has had a few issues over the course of the contract but nothing to require a new device. On Monday of last week my screen went red and then black with white lines. It hadn t been dropped  wet or damaged in any way. I was without internet and phone access until the following day when I called one of your stores. They advised me I would need to contact the insurance team as i have insurance. I spoke to them and was advised for a replacement device it would be a charge of ¬£85.00 due to the excess fee. This is not what I was told when I took out the policy nor is it a process I ve ever known before. I was disgusted as I don t have that money spare but  due to needing a phone for cases of emergencies with school etc  I paid it and requested a call from a complaints manager. I was told they would contact me on Thursday 6th October  the day after the new phone would be delivered. Today I still hadn t received a call and so rang the insurance team again. I got a very rude member of staff who  after reading the notes on the file  asked if I had received a letter advising my complaint was not upheld!! I hadn t actually made a complaint at this time  merely asked to speak to the complaints team. I asked to speak to the complaints team again and she advised me that they don t take calls!!! They read the file and then can take up to 7 weeks to respond. After working for a large corporate firm I know the complaints process and advised the 8 weeks is the ombudsman said timeframe to resolve complaints....not a timeframe to call customers to discuss the matter. She then said that a letter had been sent last night to me advising of the outcome and if I wanted to appeal it to speak to the ombudsman. I asked for an emailed copy whilst I was on the phone and she said she would do this and then came back to state that she wouldn t there and then but that I would have it within an hour. It still hasn t been received. I asked to speak to her manager but was told he wouldn t take the call as a letter had been sent. This is absolutely appalling customer service. I have the times of calls  names of staff and notes of what has been said. I will be making a formal complaint to the ombudsman. Upon my contract ending I will be leaving Tesco mobile. I was conned into an insurance policy and now I m being lied to by staff and not having any remote resolution being offered. To top this all off  there is a fault with the replacement phone to which I m told I have 24 months warranty so it can be fixed free of charge but was only given a 12month warranty with the initial handset. Ridiculous!!!! I used to think that Tesco looked after their customers but this is clearly not the case. This has really upset me and feel I ve been lied to and ignored!!!!

I have just visited your Tesco Extra branch in Ashford  Middlesex and I must say I am absolutely disgusted with the service I received.   I appreciate that some stores are the victims of theft and I can understand that your make up counter would be a important area for security measures  but to have a sign saying I have to ring a bell for someone to come and unlock the counter so I can purchase some make up  and then to be stood there for 25 minutes for anyone to come and help is RIDICULOUS!   I stood there for 10 minutes ringing this bell and no on came  I walked to the customer service desk where they made an announcement for someone to attend and still no one! By this point there was 4 customers there stood waiting with me. I walk into the centre isle to find 3 managers standing there having a conversation. I asked one of them for help to be told that she would find someone  and then to fob me off saying that the bell was not working  they WERE working as I could hear them ringing when I was continuously pressing It over and over again.  She then went off to get someone  5 minutes later she comes back with a man who unlocks the counters whilst they were laughing and joking  I didn t find it funny at all. Then under supervision I was then watched whilst they rushed me to pick my make up and then ordered to put it in a security box (which wasn t an issue).   I then went to the self service till to find I then again had to wait a further 10 minutes whilst the lady covering these tills was chatting away with another colleague and cooing over a baby. Not watching the tills at all  and I couldn t scan the make up I wanted because it was all in a box.   A simple quick 10 minute trip to Tesco turned into a 40 minute nightmare. The level of service that store did to help me was disgusting; they have no respect for there customers at all  and quite frankly I won t be going back there if I need something in a rush. Utter joke!!

Just had to share the terrible customer care I received from yourselves. On Sunday I was shopping with my family in your Taunton store minding my own business when one of your staff in an electric wheelchair ran over the back of my foot  she then proceeded to stay there until I told her she needed to reverse off my foot  which she did then she rode off mumbling under her breath  she did not even stop to ask if I was ok. As you can imagine with the weight of her and the wheelchair on the back of my foot I wasn t ok and hobbled around the store until it was so bad I went to your customer services department to report it in the accident book. At customer services the staff member called a manager and laughed as she told him I had been run over  when he arrived he wasn t very sympathetic he handed me a phone to report my accident and then when finished handed me the cheapest bunch of flowers he found in his display saying I hope these make you feel better  well they didn t. I was told someone would ring to check on me on Monday  I never received a phone call from anyone. I could not drive all of Sunday and was still hobbling yesterday.   I m all for employing people with all disabilities but that has to come with some health and safety in mind  she was clearly going to fast for such a busy day instore. The level of customer care I received on the day and since the incident has been poor to put it mildly.

Oh  Tesco. Usually I really quite like you  but on Saturday you left us cold and disappointed. We ordered a fire pit on Friday morning as your website promised it would arrive at our local store on the Saturday. The email didn t say we  might  be able to pick up our crucial element of garden warmth on Saturday - it said we  can  - which is far more promising  I am sure you d agree! We had guests travelling four and a half hours up to see us  for this weekend just gone. We went out for the day Saturday  and swung by your place at 7 o clock to claim our already paid for outdoor heating system  only to be told it wasn t going to arrive after all - and the next delivery would be Monday. Our friends left on Sunday  Tesco. SUNDAY. We were cold. They were cold. No one likes to be cold. :-( We planned on swanning around in our bikinis just because we could - knowing we would be safe from goosebumps in the blanket of high temperature the fire pit would provide us. I am sad  because apart from my terrible lack of prior planning and allowance for mistakes  this is otherwise utterly your fault. **sighs**

I think Tesco needs to make their customers aware on how long they hold lost property for. Late Saturday afternoon I attended the Lowestoft Tesco store with my daughter to do a bit of shopping later that night I realise I had left my card at the store I rang and they told me to collect as soon as possible I replied that I would as soon as I can but would be in the next few days. On Sunday my daughter was poorly so couldn t leave home Monday my car was at the garage so couldn t get to the store  on Tuesday morning I arrive at the store to be told my card had been cut up as they hold them no longer than 48 hours if I had known this previously I would of tried my best to come sooner or made other arrangements but I don t just live down the road I live 4 miles away if I wanted I could shop at Morrisons which is down the road from me but I don t I choose to shop at Tesco. As you can imagine this is very inconvenient and very annoying if it was made clear they don t hold lost cards longer than 48 hours then this upset could of been avoided.

Good morning.  We are a registered charity in East Ayrshire  Scotland and we regularly purchase baby clothes from your online store for our Baby Starter Packs  which we give out free to families in our area.  We placed an order on the 4th October online and was advised that it would be ready for collection in store on the 5th October.  We went to the Kilmarnock store to pick up our order only to be told that it would be in later that day.    We decided to leave it a day or two so it would definitely arrive  and went back to the store on the 10th October and we were informed that the order couldn t be found.  The assistant telephoned Tesco Direct to speak to them on our behalf and was on the phone to them for over half an hour trying to find out what happened.  We were then advised that the order had been lost and we were asked if we would like to re -order which we agreed to. The member of staff at Tesco Direct had to place the order manually which took another 10 minutes.    Once the order was placed  we were then advised that half of our requested items were out of stock.  Since your clothing F&F line amalgamated with Tesco Direct we have had lots of issues.  Ordering online has become difficult and it takes time to work out what is in stock and what isn t.    As a charity we are always looking for cost effective clothing for babies and are keen to purchase your items and feel that these should be clearly advertised. It is difficult to identify whether clothing suppliers such as Mothercare are being offered as a first choice rather than an affordable brand such as F&F.  As a charity  we value our time and money and if these issues are not resolved  we will have no other option but to use another store.   We look forward to hearing from you.  Eileen McCluskey  Project Coordinator.

It s with a heavy and angry hearth that write this complaint as I was treated so badly by tesco sales staff and to make matters worse the customer service was no help. This morning around 9.10 I pop into my local tesco to see what I could make for my children dinner after a while I decided on potatoes since I had chicken already on my way to the till point I was  tempted by some nuts I took a pack of peanuts and one pack of cashew nuts and some green beans once I reach to the till point I started to scan my items I noticed one of the sales assistant  telling his colleague to come and look what I was doing I paid this no mind as a black person sometimes unfortunately we do get some stereotypes  shallow minded people. Upon scanning the potatoes I realised that they where quite expensive for there was in the package so I decided I m only purchasing one I also bought a loaf of bread and some beans and left behind a packet of nuts and one packet of potato after i left the store i decided to go on the other side of the road where there was a Waitrose so I decided to have a look in there to see if it would meet my needs a bit better I found the items I needed at a cheaper price and more volume so I decided to return the potatoes that I purchased but upon me arriving in store because of the customer assistance behaviour I decided to return everything that I purchased earlier I was greeted with bad manners and attitude which later lead to a verbal altercation with one the staff while he was Taking Back the product to the shelf he made a remarks no one tell you lots to be theifts anyway this really annoyed me and I went on to make a complaint to a store manager and told him his stuff need to apologise because not only did I not put anything my bad that I didn t pay for I did not leave the store without paying for what items I have taken so therefore his staff was rude and accusing me of wrongdoing and I won t stand for it as I m also a manager at Marks and Spencer and I can tell you that there is no way under this heaven that staff could ever deal with a customer like that after speaking to customer service the guy was vaguely and said to me  if I ve spoken to a manager what do I expect him to do. this is not how tesco should do with their customers because your customer is who keeps your business running without your customer you will meet the same end as a lot of these high  street chains . I urge tesco to deal with there customers better as you have just lost a loyal customer to the Waitrose next door.

Not happy Tesco! I ordered several toys last week in a single transaction online  for me to collect from store. They were bought to as Father Christmas gifts for my twin daughters and the main present they ve asked for is a baby Annabelle doll each. I decided to collect from a store that isn t necessarily close to where I live but a town that a needed to go to for other reasons so I could run all my errands on the same day. This store is otherwise a 30min car journey out of my way. I received two separate emails to say that all of my items had been delivered to the store but it was clear they had been dispatched to the store in two deliveries - hence receiving two emails. I went to collect the toys and throughly checked that all toys fell under the same order number (which they did) and the shop assistant checked that all the parcels were all of those listed (which they were). As they were all in boxes and silver bags I couldn t see the items when collected but trusted the assistant and Tesco that the order would be correct. Whilst my daughters were still in school on this day that I happened to have off work  I took the parcels to my mums house ready to leave the toys there until Father Christmas could take credit for them. I opened them all  and I only had one baby Annabelle doll - I had definitely ordered and paid for two! The next morning I called The Tesco store I collected from and nobody on the clock and collect counter answered so my call went through to a call centre line instead. I told the story to the other person and I said it is likely the doll was left in the store room and not brought out  or it hasn t been sent along with the other doll by the depot. They said they would need to have someone at the store check so I specifically said they hadn t answered my call and I wasn t willing to wait on the phone for an unknown length of time because I was busy that day  so they said they would call the store themselves to check and call me back. I still have not received this phone call. That day I was fortunate enough to be able to make a trip to that store again 30mins form where I live before my daughters finished school. I again had to explain the situation and a new assistant checked the store room. No doll. The manager came out and was very friendly but he had no answers for me so took down my number and said he would investigate and call me back. A couple of hours later I had a call from another store assistant to say they had another doll there if I wanted to collect it. My response was that I wasn t willling to make a second trip that I shouldn t have had to have taken after already doing one earlier that day  and i preferred that it was delivered. I was especially unable to go to the store with my daughters as it was to collect their Christmas present! The manager again called back later and was more helpful explaining that the depot had forgotten to send the second doll with the other deliveries but they had one in stock and offered to deliver it - but it would only be next time one of their .com vans was coming our way and he wouldn t know the schedules until today (Monday). Fortunately my husband is off work this week  but he didn t want to be waiting in the house all week waiting to see if the doll got delivered or not  especially if it arrived when our daughters were at home. He therefore had to go back instore to collect the doll. 4 separate trips we made between us to collect these toys  it should have only taken one trip! Each journey was a 25 mile round trip  we therefore drove 75 miles for 1.5hrs unnecessarily! Absolute nothing has been offered to us to compensate the trouble we endured. We are only glad that we had time off work over the last week to make sure we could get it! Tesco call centre still haven t called us back as promised but luckily we resolved the problem ourselves. We had hoped that their phone call might have saved us from doing all that driving but after being told those dolls are out of stock online now we had desperately make sure that we got the other doll so both daughters had one for Christmas - it was already paid for! We also felt that one of the assistants in store didn t believe that we didn t have the other doll - like we were lying or hadn t checked properly. I said they could check CCTV if needs be. We shouldn t had to go to those lengths to get the items I had ordered and already paid for. We were lied to and fobbed off and had to really go out of our way to fix the problem caused by Tesco. Not impressed.
Home delivery and I must have had the most rubbish picker.... short shelf life items and couldn t even substitute potatoes for another brand of red potatoes.

Dear Tesco   I have recently read online that you are going to start to fine people who park in disabled bays who are not disabled  which i agree with. I also read you are going to fine people for parking in parent and child bays too  although some people do take advantage  ive noticed your signs state you can only park there if your child is 5 years and under. However have you considered that some parents may park in the parent and child bays because they have a child  who has a hidden disability or a condition that doesn t qualify for a disabled blue badge. I my self am guilty  i park in a child bay even though it says for children 5 and under. My child is 9 and has disability s but doesn t qualify for a mobility blue badge. When my child is having a melt down or kicking off i appreciate the wider bays purely for the safety of my son and also so he doesn t damage other cars. He isn t naughty and his behavior is not down to bad parenting its due to his condition. I think its unfair you assume once your child is out of a baby car seat the space is no longer needed. Have you considered making bays wider for parents with children under the age of 16. Not necessarily near the front of the store but somewhere within the main car park its self? Children and Adults with hidden disabilities should not be discriminated against. Yours Sincerely  A Parent with a Child who has Hidden Disabilities.

Hi So I m in your tesco today and having found out I have an allergy to soya.  So I m trying to find bread that has no soya.  So I m looking at your I store baked breads and the only allergen or lists is wheat. I m like great  that was easy. But then I think  No. That s too easy  So a after scouring the store for a tesco person  I finally find a guy in fruit and veg. Poor guy being a fruit and veg guy has no idea if the wholemeal sliced I m hopefully carrying contains soya so he trots off to find someone.  When he does its someone who is obvs off duty cos they are in a coat ect. This poor guy has no idea either  but tells my fruit and veg guy to go downstairs and ask at the bakery. So off he goes to ask with my hoped for loaf of bread  and asks if the bread contains soya.  Which it does. I thank the poor guy and head slowly to the free from section.  So here is my question.  The labels are obvs printed for each item And it obvs has room for allergens cos it states  contains wheat  so why does it not contain a full list of allergens including soya which is in bold on most other items because it s an allergen? It s four letters. Less letters than wheat and would have easily fit on the same line as  contains wheat  there would even be room for a comma. And a full stop. I mean you d going if you can put one on then you could fit the whole list....you know?

Dear Tesco  I d like to thank you for including an arithmetic puzzle with my dinner this evening.   I m currently trying to loose weight keeping a food diary  weighing foods  counting calories the whole shebang.   Tonight thought I d try the Tesco Healthy Living Mexican Whole Food Mix from the freezer aisles 500g bag serving size 150g. So I ve got 3 servings and 50g to ...... what? Spray paint gold and glue to a bit of paper for a truly unique (and smelly) birthday card?   OK I ll just use a third of the mix at a time 500 / 3 = 166.66666666667 (did that without taking my socks off and everything!) a bit awkward on the scale call it 167.   Please work out in your head whats 167 * 1.37? For the calories please? You have 3 mins for this question  I failed and over cooked the food  P.S. the above mentioned food was tasty even with me over cooking it whilst trying to remember how to do mental arithmetic.

After constant disappointments with my local Tesco store (Cleckheaton) I decided to try a newly opened Netto store (Tesco s only competition in my town). Netto was a little bit of a different experience but overall cheaper with a surprisingly good selection and choice for shoppers. Since competition opened Tesco seemed to immediately sit up and make an effort  the store was re-vamped  socks seemed to have been pulled up and the shelves were well stocked  not before time...   Netto has since closed to the dismay of many. My real problem is that since your only competitor has closed down your store has really slipped back down again. Yesterday like most other weeks I chose to do my weekly shop at this local store for convenience  how disappointing to see huge gaps on many of the shelves yet again  many items I needed were missing  the shelf labels were there so I knew you were still selling the lines I wanted but so many things were out of stock or just hadn t been filled up  it was a struggle to find staff to ask and just a real let down. I had to go further out of my way to buy the items I needed. I made a concerted effort to use your store  I may as well cut my losses and drive to a different store permanently or even a different supermarket. Tesco you need to sort this out! Complacency is a luxury you can t afford in today s supermarket wars..

Dear Tesco   It is with disappointment that I write to you regarding my recent experience with Tesco Home Delivery.    As a consumer I feel it is my duty to make conscientious decisions with regards to what I do and don‚Äôt buy in order to manage my impact on the environment  which is a big deal to me and should be for all of us.   Using your service  I very much appreciate the option to say no to plastic bags and to be able to buy loose fresh produce however this is where my gripe comes in. I purchase loose fruit and veg in order to avoid plastic packaging which cannot be recycled. When I placed my online order with yourselves  under ‚Äòcomments for delivery‚Äô I clearly stated ‚Äúplease use as little plastic packaging as possible‚Äù  yet you can imagine my frustration when my shopping arrived and still I find my single courgette  among others  arrive in individual plastic bags WITHIN a recyclable paper bag. Why is this? I will not accept that it ‚Äòmakes it easier for the cashier‚Äô as a single courgette is handled in exactly the same way  whether in or out of a bag. And I have no doubt that all of your cashiers are more than capable of handling 5 loose apples that are not held neatly together in a bag. To say it makes it easier would be an insult to your staff. I also disbelieve that it may be to protect the vegetable in question  as this plastic bag offers no padding and as I said  they all arrived together in a separate paper bag which could surely do the same job. After that  I am lost for reasons as to why this may be the case and so am disappointed in your staff‚Äôs lack of thought with regards to environmental impact and also a complete lack of regard for their customer‚Äôs requests  which were clearly stated before purchase.   Now  this is not a personal attack at the staff who packed my shopping as I‚Äôm sure they were following protocol set by the company (this is not the first instance). Therefore I am urging you  as a company  to go one step above the rest  and get rid of these unnecessary plastic produce bags completely. Paper bags are provided for mushrooms  why can‚Äôt they be used for all vegetables?  As a large company you have the power to influence and help thousands of other people to make positive changes. Think of the difference that could make  just with one small change. Empower people  don‚Äôt frustrate them by ruining their hard work.   Do not apologise for ‚Äòthis mistake‚Äô or simply thank me for my feedback. Tell me what you are going to do about this issue. I look forward to your reply.

Disappointing service this morning at crooksfoot tesco in Ashford.  Busy Sunday  found an aisle with only one person in front. After 2 of his items were scanned through he realised he d forgotten his wallet so ran out to the car park to get it from his car. I had ONE item  and my husband asked if he could just run ours through whilst he waited for the gentleman to return. He said he couldn t because he d already started scanning.  I could understand if he had already scanned a lot of items  but it was only 2 which he could easily have voided then rescanned.  When I suggested this  he IGNORED me and turned away from me! I wasn t rude in the slightest  and his lack of response was completely unnecessary.  If there is a company policy that prevented him doing so  he should have just said so. But as the guy on the next til seemed shocked he hadn t done as I suggested  I m guessing no such policy exists!

Hi there.    Just a quick message with regards to your parents and children parking bays. I live in Ammanford Wales and your store in our town is superb.  My only issue is people using the parent and child bays who have no children or display a disable badge  when the disabled bays are empty.   As a father of 2 children (4 and 12 months) I find your parents bays essential. The wider parking space allows me to safely remove and put my boys back in the car without damaging other parked vehicles whilst ensuring the safety of my children.  The purpose for which you have these bays.   I m really getting fed up of people using the bays who shouldn t be  but it ppears nothing is being done about it.  I have told staff on site but nothing ever appears to be actioned.   If it s evening and all the bays are free then it s no problem using one to pop in or use the cash point. But when it s busy  what can be done about it?  I d like to see a sign that states parents can use the disabled bays and vice versa IF THEIR OWN BAYS ARE FULL.  What are your views on this? In the big scheme of things it may seem trivial to others but to parents I belive it s an important issue that deserves consideration.  Every little helps? I honestly  hope so. Many thanks for your time in reading this. Andy.

I used to get all of my groceries and goods from Tesco until 3 weeks ago I had a bad experience regarding my mobile phone. I haven t been in since and probably never will. I am a taxi driver and so went to the store to see if anything could be done. Nothing could according to the staff I saw there and was told I would have to take it to get repaired and so I bought another cheap mobile to get me by as it was and is my livelihood. A couple of days later I rang customer service and a lady by the name of Hannah said she could help me out and over the phone gave me instructions as to what was probably wrong and explained what to do. This was totally successful and my Sony is now perfect again. When I explained to her I had bought another phone to get me by she told me to go back to the store and they would probably refund me the ¬£25 it cost. This I did only to be told by a woman on Customer Service  and I quote  If you want your money back I suggest you take your phone back to the person who told you to bring it here  and ask her for it  That is where the conversation with this person in Oakham ended. I wasn t over bothered about the ¬£25 but I was flabbergasted at the rudeness of the comment. If she didn t want to give me a refund that is fine. There are ways of dealing with customers though  and I am sure this isn t one of them. Consequently  she has lost Tesco a customer.

I would like to post about our experience in your Market Deeping superstore. I went in on Friday around 6pm with my children  and as I m trying to encourage my 10 year old autistic son social and communicative skills  he went up to customer services to get some flowers wrapped. Now usually we would be rushed through these opportunities with very little interaction  and child centred approach to conversations  this young gentleman was so patient  kind and gave my son perfect opportunities to facilitate his conversing skills  he gave him full attention  asked him questions  got to his level and made it a really positive experience for him. It s the little things like this that pave the way to positive interactions and build confidence and self esteem to such children who perhaps struggle in situations we take for granted.  I only know his name was Ben (which my son is also Ben which naturally made his day) he helped on customer services but was in a Tesco Mobile uniform and usually on that department. Thank you Ben! Tagging Tesco friends who may know this guy Emma Martin Emma Hennessy Alex Buttery Susan Pateman Michelle Bateman #postivefeedback #littlethingsmakeabigdifference #autismawareness

I just read an article about tesco fining people who misuse disabled or parents spaces.  Whilst I m all for this (if its true)  I m concerned that they are completely overlooking pregnant women.   I m 8 months pregnant and whilst walking and having enough energy to shop is difficult enough at that stage  I also suffer from severe pelvic girdle pain and am on crutches. I have had a couple people make comments when I have parked at my local tesco in the parents bays because I don t always have my 5 year old with me  or shoot me dirty looks before I even get out of my car based on assumptions.    Many of your competitors make it clear that parents spaces are also welcome to be used by expectant mothers - I have on more than one occasion gone there instead to avoid the hassle at tesco.   If you could recognise expectant mothers as part of parents welcome to park on parent bays this would be welcome in my opinion -particularly if you are looking to start fining people. It s very difficult for women at that stage to have energy or stamina to go to the store and  every little helps!   even if it s a small gesture like making pregnant women feel more welcome.    If pregnant women aren t welcome to park in parent bays  why not? Yiu cannot assume that every pregnant woman is able bodied and even the underground has bump badges so women don t have to ask for a seat or be made to feel uncomfortable.    Pelvic girdle pain is actually given temporary blue badges at some councils and there is a movement to recognise this across more areas - and up to 20% of women suffer this in pregnancy. So please bear in mind this demographic before you start letting unsympathetic employees give penalty fines and generally make sire that they are aware that not every disability is visible either!!   Just because someone can walk doesn t mean they don t suffer ulcerative colitis  crohns  fibromyalgia   or some other illness that means they are disabled.  I hope you have thought through exactly how employees would be equipped with the judgement before they send across pictures to the parking enforcers for fines - staff in customer services generally need up skilling on equality and diversity and you could be opening a massive can of worms.

As I walked back to where my son was standing with my mum a gentleman walked out of the staff private area and I asked for a cup of water so my son could get rid of the taste of apple which the gentleman got and asked if everything was ok when I explained what happened he got down to my son s level and asked if he was ok and offered him a free bag of sweets. I was expecting a pack of sweets however the bloke returned with a multipack of haribo to say sorry. Unfortunately I didn t get the blokes name but he was fantastic and when I saw him again in store he asked again if my son was ok. I just want you to know that he is a lovely bloke and very helpful.

Hey Tesco! I ve just had the run around looking for the  Speak Out Game  at your Merthyr and Aberdare stores. Tesco direct shows that they are in both stores. I popped to Merthyr last night and the shelf with the ticket on was empty  it has been for around a week now. I asked on customer services and the gent informed me that there were 8 in stock and popped to the warehouse to see if he could find any  he didn t have much luck but asked me to pop in when someone on the department was there to have a good look.  In the meantime I popped to the aberdare store as I thought it may be easier and it showed the game was in stock according to the website. When I got there  there wasn t even a ticket for the item  the store assistant wasn t much help and just palmed it off as not being put on display yet. I then returned to the Merthyr Tesco  I advised the assistant that I was told by customer services that there were 8 in stock but the shelves have been empty for days. The advisor told me she d been through most of the crates this morning and if it wasn t there it wasn t there  after reiterating that customer services said last night there was 8 in stock she went to the warehouse  again to no avail.  I m quite disappointed not so much by the customer service  but at the fact you obviously seem to have some stock issues in both stores and the fact that some colleagues are not even bothered by the discrepancy in the store systems and the actual stock levels... I hope that you will feed this back to both stores as obviously there is something going amiss and they can then take the relevant measures to resolve the issues.   Unfortunately  someone will not be getting the game as a birthday gift off me due to this issue but hopefully you can prevent it happening to others!

Hi Tesco. I went into your store on Sinclaire Street in Helensburgh today with my 15 year old autistic son. On entering I noted there were woman wearing  stand up to cancer  packing bags at the checkouts. ( A very worthy cause).  The store was quite busy and my son was showing signs of becoming anxious early on. By the time we reached the checkout he was gripping at his ears  lashing out and starting to shake. This is where your Helensburgh team really showed they re worth their weight in gold!  Whilst in the line a staff member asked if he could help in any way. I explained the issues my son was having. He went to the bag packer and quietly explained  and then he and the bag packer walked away from the till without saying a word. The lady on the checkout ( Margaret) put the  till closing  sign on and asked me very quietly if I needed bags or a hand packing. As I was holding my son she took my shopping from me and loaded it onto the conveyor belt  and packed it away. No fuss  no song and dance  just gentle grace. I paid and thanked her and left the shop. On leaving the sign was removed  Margaret had more customers pass through her checkout and the bag packer returned to her task. I managed to leave with my son in shut down mode NOT melt down. I didn t have to ditch my shopping and leave without my groceries. I didn t have to restrain him. I didn t have to lift him from the floor.  May not seem a big deal to some  but to me this was the best service from any store ever. The staff just knew what to do. I can not thank you enough!

Hi Tesco  I d really like to buy FIFA 17 for PS4 from you  but I m beginning to get the feeling that you don t want to sell. I called in  to your Newton-le-Willows/Earlestown store  a few days ago and you had a display complete with games. I picked one up and took it to the till. I was told  after queuing-up  that I couldn t pay for it there and that I needed to go to the cigarette kiosk/click & collect desk - as that s where the games are kept (which seemed fine to me  except for the massive queue  which was being served by one person and that nearly everyone in the queue  aside from myself and some children (also buying FIFA 17)  were cigarette buyers/smokers - i.e. largely stinking of stale cigarette smoke). It took ten minutes to get to the front of the queue. It was at this point  that things really started to take a dark turn. FIFA 17 wasn t in stock for PS4. No explanation was offered as to why the FIFA17 for PS4 boxes were still on the shelves  let alone on a prime location display. Today  I thought I d try again. I called ahead to check FIFA 17 was in stock. I was told there were loads [of copies] (for PS4) on the shelves. I called in. I queued up (this time at the stinky-queued kiosk immediately). I was psyched and excited  finally I thought - only to be told it was out of stock again. A little annoyed  I questioned why the PS4 version boxes were on the shelves - I got a slight apology  and the games were taken down. Now things wouldn t be too bad  except for the fact that  two minutes away from TESCO  on my way home  at a traffic-light I wouldn t have been at - if not for visiting TESCO  some children threw a milkshake at me  which rather completely covered me and my motorbike.   So  my question to you  TESCO  is  is this just some round-about way of sending me a message that you don t want me to play FIFA 17?  - A supremely disappointed (& miffed) Pete

Yesterday was one of the worst experiences of my life at Tesco‚Äôs (Goodmayes); I had been accused of stealing for simply putting a receipt in my own bag. Yesterday around 12:30pm just before leaving the store I had returned an item  I then walked around looking at a few products such as make-up. I had also purchased some snacks. After paying for my items I walked towards the exit to leave the store  however the alarm went off and I was immediately stopped by two male security guards. They requested to look through my belongings and they had asked me to empty my bag within the front store open to the public. Firstly they were not allowed to search me in front of the public. They in fact had to do a search behind closed doors. After the security guards found nothing they continued to accuse me and asked what make-up did I ‚Äòsteal‚Äô. In shock I explained exactly what I done within the store  I had returned an item  looked at a few products for a short period of time followed by purchasing some snacks. I expressed that I did not steal anything as it is not in my nature to do such a thing. A friend of mine had come entered the store and saw what was going on  he insisted on helping me and he was also shocked that they would make such accusations. After thoroughly searching my bag the security guards were still not satisfied so they therefore called for another security guard who had then escorted me and my friend to an isolated room where they could do a further search. I felt so embarrassed and they made me feel so petite. I could not believe that they would accuse me of stealing. Stealing or being dishonest is something that is not in my heart and I would never even consider the thought of stealing anything from anyone. I am a hard working and a religious girl. I was in tears that they had continued to accuse me.   After bringing me to an isolated room  another male security guard had further searched my bag  belongings and my jacket. I felt even more embarrassed that a male security guard would go through my belongings especially that I am a female and I carry around products for female and personal reasons. After their second attempt to search me they found nothing  however they still continued to accuse me of stealing ‚Äúmake-up‚Äù  they asked ‚Äúwhere did you put the make-up‚Äù they also stated that it was a white item. In tears I continued to express that I would never steal anything. For almost the fifth time I explained that I had returned an item and the only thing that I had placed within my own bag was the receipt from the item I had returned. They stated that they monitored me throughout my time in the store  so there is no way they could assume that I would place a stolen item elsewhere. They came to realisation that I did not steal an item and they were willing to let me go  I was so upset  disappointed and frustrated that I wanted to make a complaint for how unprofessional this situation was dealt with. The security guard called in the store manager ‚ÄòHus‚Äô  after he assessed the video he also accused me of stealing an item. My friend was just as frustrated and shocked as myself; therefore he requested to see the security footage. The security guards and the store manager ‚ÄòHus‚Äô allowed my friend to view the security footage. After my friend watched the security footage he did notice that I had put something into my bag  he immediately expressed that it does not look anything like an item or a product whatsoever  in fact he agreed that it was a paper material ‚Äòthe receipt‚Äô that I had continuously expressed to the security guards. My friend was so frustrated that they had wasted our time for making the biggest mistake. The manager ‚ÄòHus‚Äô and security guards were very opinionated that a product was stolen. The ‚Äòmanager‚Äô stated that they would normally inform the police to do a search. My response from the very beginning was to inform the police  I told them many times to call a female police officer to do another full search. I had no problems whatsoever with informing the police. I know how valuable a police officer‚Äôs time is  and if they did call the police they would have wasted their time too. The manager was willing to let us go as they could not find a product that they thought was stolen.   The manager ‚ÄòHus‚Äô did apologise to an extent that this was a misunderstanding on their behalf. At this point I felt relieved that he was taking ownership for their mistakes  however he made a very sarcastic comment by saying ‚Äúin my opinion  it looks like you have picked up a product and placed it into your bag.‚Äù I then realised that he did not mean his apology as he continued to accuse me. I felt even more upset. The two security guards did not want to acknowledge that they were in the wrong and not at any point did they want to take ownership for their mistakes. To top this off and to make things even more embarrassing a crowd of ‚ÄòTesco‚Äô employees from different departments were standing and watching from outside the room I was interrogated in. The door was wide open for the employees to watch and pretend as if they were doing work in a security office. This was very irrelevant  unprofessional and shameful. The feeling was even more unbearable. After me and my friend were free to leave  as there was no stolen item and I was undoubtedly innocent. As I walked out I felt so out of place that they had accused me of being a criminal. After I was searched I left with the exact same items that I had purchased and all my belongings that I brought into the store. After passing through the security ‚Äòalarm‚Äô by the exit  no alarms had gone off  they therefore intentionally turned on the alarms from when I was previously leaving the store. It made no sense  for someone to steal a make-up product there is no doubt that the alarms will go off. This therefore justifies that I did not steal anything.   After leaving the store I had called Tesco‚Äôs head office to make a complaint. I spoke to a kind lady and I thoroughly addressed my complaint expressing every detail possible. She immediately apologised for what had happened and she had agreed that this was very unprofessional. She also informed me that something will be done about this  as this is not the service Tesco provide. She insisted that she will get down to the bottom of this situation and contact me as soon as possible. It has been 24 hours and I still await for her call. I will now be contacting the ‚Äòombudsman‚Äô to make a further complaint.  I am extremely dissatisfied with how this was dealt with. It was very unprofessional  and I felt so embarrassed about what had happened. Tesco Extra in Goodmayes is my local grocery store  I shop there on a weekly basis and sometimes I come in as often as a five times per week. I have a lot of  family  friends and work colleagues who also shop at Tesco‚Äôs. A work colleague of mine also saw what had happened. I was so embarrassed that I did not go into work today as everyone will know what happened in the event that took place yesterday. Although I did nothing wrong I would never want people I know to even think that I would ever committee such a disgusting crime. The event that happened yesterday has left me so upset that I no longer feel comfortable shopping at Tesco‚Äôs Goodmayes. Firstly due to the security guards and the manager for how they treated me  also the random employees who decided to watch and for those I personally know who may have saw the incident.   As a customer I did not feel as if I was respected by the security guards or the manager ‚ÄòHus‚Äô. Never could I imagine I would receive such poor and unprofessional behaviour from Tesco‚Äôs and its employees  one of the leading stores in the UK.

Placed an online grocery order for food to be delivered to us while on holiday  on 24/9/16 to an address in Alnmouth 4 and 5pm. I did receive a call from the store late morning on Sunday 25 September stating that they may be able to delivery in the afternoon/evening  despite my instruction the previous evening to cancel and refund the order.  Again I requested the order be cancelled and refund and was advised it would take 5-7 working days to refund?  Sent an email to this effect to your Customer Service on Monday 3/10/16 and received a call earlier this afternoon to say that the refund had never be actioned but it would now and could take another 3-5 days?   I have to say that I have been very disappointed at the service received at this time.  I have placed several grocery orders  over the last 5-6 years  that have been delivered to remote addresses and have had no problems/delays until now. Ok so im not normally one to do this but here goes.... why do we have to pay for bags now? I thought it was because of the environment and landfill and plastic bags not being bio degradable!  So when doing my food shopping online to click and collect i tick the pack my shopping with bags just to make my life easier for once. It was a weekly shop for my household of 5 so it was pretty big!  Now my normal weekly shop i manage to get in about 5-6 reusable shopping bags. Whilst putting my shopping in the car i couldnt help but think it was packed in alot of bags!  When i got home i counted the bags  some of which only had one item in them  there was 28 bags in total!  Now i dont care about paying 5p for a bag its not about that its more about the fact the government put in this rule to stop us wasting and harming the environment but what penalty is there for big companies like tesco over using the plastic bags! I mean 28 plastic bags and at least 10 of them had one item in!  In future i shall make sure i check the without bags box when shopping on line!

LET DOWN BY TESCO DIRECT AGAIN.  On Sunday I ordered a LEGO Classic Large Creative Box 10697 from Tesco to collect from my local Tesco garage.  I was told both before and after the order:  You can collect your order after 3pm on 3/10/2016.    I received an email at 06:24 on the 3rd saying  We have just dispatched your order 4D4G6HMYF.   I drove to the garage immediately after work  but when I got there at about 16.45  the member of staff rumaged around in the storeroom and came back saying that they could not trace the package  and that I would need to phone customer services.  When I got back home I phoned customer services and spoke to an assistant called Mohammed. I explained what had happened  and he was courteous and polite.  He checked with the courier company s website and said that Tesco had failed given the courier the package. I pointed out that at no point had Tesco contacted me to tell me the package was not actually on the way and that I had had a thirty minute round journey in vain.  He apologised for (as he put it) the cowardice of Tesco s not informing me that the packet was not on the way and offered to send another packet  but now that it was after 5pm he could not promise that it would arrive today (the 4th).    I have received no further email and looked at the website this evening and still can only see the original dispatch on the 3rd.  I am not planning on driving over to the garage tonight in the vain hope that it has arrived undocumented.  I can only hope it will arrive tomorrow  because my son keeps on asking where it is.  This is not the first time.  A couple of years ago they claimed to have left a crate of wine in my garden  which never came (and they could not describe where they had left it)  then when they tried again  they claimed noone was in  even though I had stayed in all day  so I assume on both occasions the delivery driver went to some other address.  As I told Mohammed  if I don t get the Lego tomorrow  I shall try to find it locally and shall send them the bill.  Tesco offers a good discount  so it will end up more expensive  but it is the only reasonable way that I can have my contract with them fulfilled.  Hopefully it will not come to that and if it does hopefully they will pay up immediately rather than forcing me to escalate the complaint up the management chain  though the ombudsman  and ultimately through the small claims process. It is shameful to give such shoddy service  especially for products that they must know children are likely to be looking forward to.

Absolutely gutted  I was so excited all day to drink the whole tub of double cream I bought at the weekend before it s best before date tomorrow. Open it up  lick the lid (the best bit) and to my horror  it s already gone off. Help me out Tesco  I feel so cheated. ‚òπÔ∏è

I don t believe in complaining unnecessarily  I really don t  but I ve had a really unpleasant experience in one of your stores this afternoon that has left me feeling really lousy and I think it needs to be escalated.  I am referring to the Tesco Express store in Uplands  Swansea  SA2 0EY where I shop regularly. Today I went in to buy a few top up shopping needs and was pulled aside by a lady who works there regularly who told me the duty manager wanted to speak to me about some unpaid goods. I was a bit incredulous about this to start with as I am a very honest person  not that this should make the blindest bit of difference to the situation. The duty manager came out and said that I had only paid for half of my shopping on a previous in store occasion. Apparently the cashier had put through that I had paid half in cash and half on my card and I had dishonestly not made them aware of this. I would wholeheartedly agree that it would be unusual  though not unheard of  for me to pay half my bill in cash and half on card  but I would never not correct a mistake of this kind. In fact there have been previous occasions when I have corrected the cashier for undercharging me. The duty manager couldn t tell me when this allegedly happened  but said he would show me a receipt to prove it had happened. After leafing through papers for a good five minutes  he told me that he had been unable to find the offending receipt and that I was free to go.  I was really offended that this entire exchange played out in front of a shop full of people  many of whom I knew. I was accused of having done something dishonest without the slightest bit of proof. I ve shopped in this store for two years  probably spending in excess of ¬£75 per week and I m completely put off visiting again. The service has never been good there- it s not unheard of to spend five minutes waiting for alcohol purchases to be authorised  to be told to just use the self service machines if the girl behind the counter is restocking cigarettes  to have to navigate around the orders that always seem to be put away during the morning and evening rush hour etc  but this has really upset me.  May I suggest that if this incident even happened in the first place that the store firstly takes responsibility for their cashier s mistake and further to this  if they do want to pursue it with me that they have  the evidence  to hand instead of making me wait red faced in front of a shop of my acquaintances having essentially been accused of stealing. I am an honest person- had I realised I had been undercharged I would have mentioned it  but if it did happen the way they allege it did  it was certainly without my realising.   I m really disappointed. You would expect better customer service from a retail giant like Tesco.

C mon guys you really need to get your act together. It s bad enough when you mix your metric units on a single product. for example Kg and Grams on the cheese. But most people can work that one out! But it s still not good as there are a few people who can t even do that type of simple arithmetic.   However I just went in to Milton Cambridge Tesco and was surprised to find grapes  one packaging marked with the price per Kg and a different packaging marked in imperial pounds and ounces.  Now if I was the type of person to be cynical I would think it s a con to make the larger package seem to be less expensive as I suspect trading standards would.  My mental arithmetic does not run to converting metric to imperial weight  Ask around your office and see if any of you can?   When did we stop teaching imperial units in school?? I left school in 1971 and we were using metric then.  You really need to get this sorted and have a common unit for at least the same products. In the ideal world you should have everything displayed with a price per Kg or gm.

On Friday 2nd September whilst in the traffic que waiting to leave tesco Bursledon  one of your home delivery drivers reversed their van into the front of my car. I cannot fault the customer care I received from your transport manager Marcus  as he dealt with the situation well and took full responsibility of the accident and gave clear instructions to both me and the driver to resolve the issue of my damaged car.   It took the company 2 weeks from this date to come and collect my car for repair. As promised I received a courtesy car  which was supposed to be a like for like comparison to my car (Honda jazz). I received a 4 seater smart car. This car is very small and is not very spacious at all. The two back seats are only able to fit children.  This has made it very difficult to make trips in this car  as I have a disabled sister and a mum who suffers from arthritis  neither of which can sit in the back of the car without causing pain or discomfort. I have therefore had to rearrange plans and rely on taxis  or friends and family for lifts out. I drove the car to do my weekly shop and put my shopping in the boot. I was not made aware when given the car that the engine was under the boot space and this would become warm when driving  resulting in me loosing most of my frozen goods bought on that day. Furthermore the smart car I currently have is now due a service and does not have any screen wash in. I would expect all this to be checked before lending out the car.  The GC South company that have taken my car for repair have now had my car for 12 days and not once updated me on the progress of the repairs. I had to phone them myself on 28th September to ask how much longer it would be for the repairs to my car will be complete as an email I received stated that the completion date is the 29th September. I still have not received my car and it is 3rd October. My car is due in for a mot in 7 days‚Äô time and I cannot book it in until I can guarantee I have received my car back.   All this would not be so much of an issue if I only had this car for a short amount of time  but it has now been a 4 weeks and 3 days since the incident happened and it has not been dealt with very quickly  causing great inconvenience and stress.   I have also tried talking to people in your bursledon store who said they will look into things and contact me by 6pm tonight as to when I will receive my car back and why no one is communicating with each other and myself but this also hasn t happened!   I look forward to hearing from you about this. Kerry Harder

This evening my car broke down at your garage on Wells Road in Bristol. I had to go into store to ask for the post code so that recovery knew where I was. The staff on shift were so lovely and friendly. They let me use the loo and sit in the staff room while I was waiting so that I didn t get cold. They even offered me a coffee. As a young woman out on my own in the dark this was so lovely and made me feel safe. A massive thank you to all the staff for looking out for me. A little kindness goes a long way.

Tesco  Recently whenever I have tried to use either pay at pumps in your fuel stations or self-service at the checkouts that my tesco clubcard has not been accepted. (It is OK when using the normal tills). Out of principle I took my receipts (3 in total) into Infirmary Road  Sheffield branch to be credited.  I was served by a pleasant young guy.  Whilst adding my points I asked is it normal that the self-service tills don‚Äôt accept my clubcard and why this would be the case.  Straight away an old woman (store manager I believe who was watching over the young guy rudely interrupted and chirped in we can only do 2 receipts at a time. I explained my situation to her and she accused me of being fraudulent (even though the last receipt was only for 1 point!! Again it‚Äôs principle and more over I would like to have known why my card is not working correctly.) The woman  who identified herself as Karen Jackson said it wasn‚Äôt her problem and I should revisit the stores I can‚Äôt use my clubcard at and ask them.  Now presently I‚Äôm living in Sheffield so to drive to Dundee store is 320 miles then onto Glossop store is 297 miles and back to where I am staying is 25 miles  totalling 642 miles.  I charge 45 pence /mile totalling ¬£288.90.  I am an Airline captain and my daily rate is ¬£450 per day  which I believe the whole journey will take about a day to complete.  I also charge ¬£5 for lunch and ¬£15 for an evening meal.  Could you please arrange for a cheque to be sent totalling ¬£758.90 so I complete as requested by your employee Karen Jackson.  This besides I still believe after my journey it will be no clearer why my clubcard does not work whenever I‚Äôm not interfacing with a human. I find the rudeness and lack of customer care represented by Karen Jackson to fall well short of that expected by a huge international company.  I have not experienced such shortfalls with Sainsburys  Morrison and Waitrose and their loyalty stores cards have always worked as intended.

I would just like to acknowledge the excellent customer service I received at the St.Mellons store in Cardiff this morning.  Monday mornings are always a bit stressful when you r a busy mum of 3 and extras (I m a childminder).  Whilst fishing around in my bag earlier on today for that elusive pound coin and with a 1 year old attached to my hip a lovely trolley girls came up to me and asked if I needed any help. My reply being  I m fine I just need to pop inside to get change for the trolley . Her reply   No need to do that I can unlock the trolley for you .  Something so small to others made a huge difference to my morning!! With baby all secured in the trolley we walk straight to the fruit and veg where the baby spotted the bananas . This being her favourite word at the moment as well as  yellow  she repeatedly told me what they were in a very excited manner. A lovely manager who was in the process of restocking as led me if she liked bananas which I replied yes too. He then took the time to look through the pre packed bananas   opened them and offered me the bunch to pick one for her. There were loose ones on the stand but were obviously  the ones that people had left so rather than offering me one of those which still would have been a lovely gesture he hunted for a fresher bunch!! These two kind gestures together made what was normally quite a stressful experience on a Monday morning a lot more pleasurable !!!  Thankyou Tesco St. Mellons for doing that little bit extra and brightening up my day!!!! :-) :-)

Hi Tesco. I have a quick question.  How come you you can debit my bank account BEFORE you deliver any goods to my house as part of an online order  but when that delivery fails and no recovery action is carried out  it takes 3working days for the money to come back? I was very disappointed today when I went to the Tesco Extra in Slough to buy the new The Shires album  My Univerise  and was told I couldn t have it. I picked it up from the shelf (where there was no price tag) and took it to the self serve with all my other shopping.  Firstly  the bar code wouldn t scan so had to wait ages to actually be noticed by a member of staff. She then took it out of the protective case and it still wouldn t scan. The system  didn t recognise this item . She said would call someone else to assist us but after waiting around 15/20 minutes of standing at the self serve she eventually flagged someone down and asked about the CD.   She came back and told us she couldn t sell it to us as she didn t know the price. We queried this but she took the CD away and just said we couldn t have it  depsite being nurmourous copies on the shelf and it being released the previous Friday.    Surely there is a system in place  some kind of inventory/stock system like most retail establishments where the item can be searched for to find the price. Surely even a quick search on their own website would have helped them find the price. But sadly  they didn t even bother to check this. It was easier for them to not sell us the CD than it would be to go and check the price.   So after waiting for maybe 25 at this point  we were then not able to buy the CD (which was one of the main reasons for coming into Tescos today). This also seems pretty unfair for the band in question  who will now not be able to have a sale for their CD and this could affect their position in the charts.  I really do hope this issue is sorted as the customer service was poor  we barely got an apology for our wait and the staff didn t seem to care that we weren t able to leave with our product  just told a  No  you can t have this . Begs the question of why even display this item at all if you won t let anyone purchase it? I m sure the CD we were denied went straight back on the shelf and no one took the time to find out the price or take them off the shelves to stop this happening again.

Dear Tesco  listen to Daisy #StandWithDaisy

I wonder  Tesco  if you d be willing to take a leading role in removing gender stereotypes from your children s clothing range? I recognise this is a problem across the clothing industry  but change needs to start somewhere and you have a very powerful voice! Girls and boys alike need clothing which is practical for them to be able to run and play  and feel that their ideas and dreams are respected regardless of their gender. I work with pre-school children  and fighting those stereotypes is so hard when they re constantly being reinforced by clothing and toy marketing in the media and in big stores such as yours. I d love to see such a big company take a stand and get the ball rolling on this much needed change!   #standwithdaisy #amightygirl
