On Thursday evening I opened a box of Quaker Oats that I bought in your Southend on sea extra store to find it quite literally moving with bugs!  As somebody who suffers from (diagnosed) OCD you can imagine how horrified I was!   To my horror I have found them crawling all over my larder cupboard and after some research the advice was to throw all food they may have been in contact with - Pasta  rice  crackers  cereal bars  couscous  cereals  dry cat food etc - in fact my cupboard is now literally bare!  I have spent the last two days spraying insecticide into all of my cupboards and washing all of my crockery and according to my research the life cycle is approx a month for all eggs to hatch so I cannot refill my cupboards until then!  I am severely stressed by the idea of bugs in my house not to mention severely out of pocket!!  Not a happy customer!!

Tesco and me are not on good terms..  I today went to the local Trent Vale branch of Tesco in 287 Newcastle Road  Stoke-on-Trent  ST4 6PL   armed with 6 unique Covent garden internet printable vouchers in black and white. I purchased a number of items along with 6 Covent garden soups  I had also got 6 vouchers from the company which was  new Covent garden  soups Co.  Paying through self scan I was allowed to insert 2 vouchers without any problem  scanning the 3rd voucher an alert message appear for a supervisor intervention pops up. Fine I thought  so along comes the self scan body and checks everything.  This is where the fun starts  she quizzed me over the vouchers  she asked a manager about them who duly tooted along and started to accuse me of fraud not directly i may add  she said the vouchers were photocopies and she wanted originals and the originals had a silver strip down them  I explained that these were  internet printable  vouchers and they do not have a silver strip on them for the obvious reasons  however the  duty manager for the day was adamant that they were not original despite me telling her till I was blue in the face. Even going as far as explaining how they are generated.  The duty manager informed that the companies should be  posting genuine   vouchers   through the mail i m sorry but who is she to tell companies how they should be issuing promotional money off vouchers and coupon?  I requested the 6 vouchers they had in their hand back as I stated that I had used the same type previously on another visit a few days prior  the security   self scan operator and also the Duty Manager refused to give them back.  I challenged them on this stating that they were my property and had indeed been duly printed honestly and with good intent and that I wished to have them back so I could go to Sainsbury;s to redeem them.  I was refused by all three members of staff and did not get the vouchers returned  by this time people were standing around and watching  I felt intimated  belittled and made to feel as though I was committing fraud  I duly left after emptying my bags for life of the shopping I had purchased.  On contacting the duty manager for the store in general he stated tjhat it was due to the multiple names on the vouchers  I would like to add that as long there is one unique voucher to one unique invidual  then this should not create a problem. How many customers purchase shopping for disabled partners  friends  neighbours   relatives etc etc.

I had a really bad experience at your Aylesbury 1 store. I bought a phone from you less than 28 days ago. The phone has been awful: freezing  buttons jamming and yesterday the power button fell off. The assistants attitude was awful  he at one point face planted onto his computer screen in some amateur-dramatic response to me spelling my name (the only reason that I can think of for such a ridiculous response is some sort of transphobic reaction to a trans masculine person having a name he felt should be a woman s name). His whole attitude felt like it was designed to make me feel like I was being unreasonable or a trial on his patience just for existing and being in the shop asking for a replacement of a phone that was/is not up to standard with several faults it shouldn t have developed within the 26 days I ve owned it. It also felt like he was looking for excuses not to help me (searching the phone for any mark on it that he could use to refuse a refund  at one point claiming damage on the screen which turned out to be a fleck of dirt).

I m having to contact you on here as no one is returning my calls.  Friday 30th September. My shopping was delivered with 12 items missing. I contacted your call centre and spoke to Lauren.(5pm) Lauren spent ages trying to get through to the store and told me that I would be getting a call back. Lauren was very helpful and refunded my delivery charge and also mailed me a fifteen pound e voucher by way of an apology. 2 hours later I d had no call so I called again. I was told that the person that should have called me back was named Levinson. He was on his break and would be calling me back at 8.20pm. 8.50pm stll no call so I called your call centre again. Spoke to Mark who left another message for Levinson to call me back and said it would be just after 9pm. Levinson finally returned from his mammoth break and called me at 9.25pm. No apologies instead denial that he had been given any messages to call me and said that he had been waiting for my delivery van to return to see if my missing items were there. I asked him how he knew I had missing items if he had not had any messages. He chose not to answer and asked me to tell him what my missing items were. I did. He assured me that they would be delivered the next day (1.10.16) between 11am and 12pm. (He had a bad attitude and was quite abrupt). Mark did call me back to check that Levinson had finished eating his Kit Kat and had called me. Saturday (1.10.16) 12.15pm.....Don t you just know....the missing items have not arrived. I call the call centre again. I spoke to Claire. She tried calling the store 3 times but there was no answer. (Levinson was probably on another break). To save me hanging on (again) Claire said she would call me back which she did to inform me that I wouldn t be getting my delivery today.Claire wanted to know what the missing items were so I told her and she said they would be delivered on Sunday (2.10.16) between 1pm and 2 pm.Claire told me that a manager from the store would be contacting me.(I believe the store is Greenford/Perivale) I got an email straight away from Claire showing that my delivery was scheduled for today with the missing items. I also got an email showing that the 12 items had been refunded and that I would get that refund in 3-5 days. Sunday (2.10.16) 1.15pm my order arrives. It s all there (not in carrier bags which I had previously paid for). On my receipt I noticed that not only had I been charged the delivery charge again I had also been charged because my order was under forty pounds. Are you having a laugh? The money for the missing items had been taken from my account this morning although the refund will take 3-5 days. So again I call your call centre dreading having to listen to the music that makes my ears bleed while life passes me by. I get through. I explain the whole sorry saga all over again. The man says he will refund my delivery charge and the minimum order charge. He then asks if I want anything else...yes I want to speak to a manager at the store because no one has called me back and I want to check that Levinson isn t being overworked and getting plenty of breaks..Man on phone puts me on hold. Another 10 minutes passes me by. No one is answering the phone at the store. Man on phone promises that someone will call me today or maybe tomorrow. Forgive me if I have no faith that I will get a call back.  So my questions are;Why did Levinson deny that he had any messages to call me? Why did it take him so long to call me back? Why was I promised my delivery on Saturday morning by Levinson and it never arrived? Why has no manager called me back? Why am I currently out of pocket because of Tesco s mistakes? And how long are your breaks at Tesco for your employees?  I get my shopping delivered by you every week and spend quite a bit of money. Apart from the man I spoke to today at your call centre all the other people have been helpful.(Obviously Levinson is not included in that either). Can someone please get in contact with me so that I can get some satisfactory answers? Many thanks.

Dear Tesco   Sadly I am writing this due to an incident that just happened at the Stalham Tesco in Norfolk.  I have never received such poor customer service in a Tesco until I moved to Stalham. Several times I have been in the store and asked a member of staff where a certain item might be  each time I was told they were out of stock and each time I have been about to leave the store when I see the item I was looking for had been placed by the door for promotional purposes  I assume. This is just laziness from the staff. However  the incident I am complaining about is unrelated other than by location.  I had just arrived and parked my car  I was walking towards the store when I heard a lady shouting in frustration. I could see a woman struggling to open the boot of her car to place a Zimmer frame in there. The person behind her had parked over their space and into hers. Now there were two trolley attendants only a few feet away from her and they ignored her completely. I could hear her from halfway across the carpark and seeing that no one was helping  I walked over and helped her to get the frame in her car. I went into the store and spoke to someone and informed them what happened. I do not feel satisfied with the response of  I will tell them  referring to the attendants.  As a customer  I expect good service whether I am in the car park  at the petrol station or on the store. It is unacceptable that your staff do not provide this service. As a staff member  customer service should be a top priority but on top of that  you are a human being and surely it should be nature to help someone who clearly needs it? I understand you can t change someone s natural instinct but it should be a heavy part of the training to be BOTHERED about the customers around you.   This store has tarred my opinion of Tesco which used to be very high. If there was another supermarket close by to my house  I would change without a second thought. I m sure the poor lady that was struggling today  would want to as well.

I realised ¬£10 into fuelling that I was holding a green handle  not black. I grabbed my nearly-3 year old  ran into the kiosk  and explained what had happened. Whilst I called help  Pauline entertained my daughter  keeping her happy and chatty. When I had to run back out for my handbag  which I d left in panic in the car  she took Lilly into the office so I wouldn t have to carry her out in the pouring rain.  She offered us both a drink whilst we waited for my husband to fetch my daughter  and was really friendly and supportive. I honestly can t thank them enough for how helpful and kind they have been to us. Is it possible I could pay for some flowers or chocolates to be sent as a thank you and recognition for their help today?Thanks  Wendy x

After many years of using Tesco to deliver my groceries I m very unhappy to say that I am completely dissatisfied with the service I received this week.  I ordered ¬£60 worth of groceries to be delivered between 9pm and 10pm on Wednesday evening  as I was having people round for dinner the next day.  At 10.30pm there was no sign of my delivery  nor had anyone contacted me to say that the delivery driver was running late.  I contacted the customer services number and spoke to someone who told me that the delivery driver had returned to the store with my order as he was running late and could not deliver my order after 10pm because my order contained alcohol (one bottle of wine).  I think it was completely unfair that because the delivery driver was running late  I did not receive my order at all.  I was not contacted at all by someone to explain this  until AFTER I had phoned customer services  nor was I given the option of having my order delivered without the alcohol  and by the time I had spoke to someone in customer services about my order they said it was then too late for them to re-deliver the order that night.  This then put me in a predicament as I was having people round for dinner the following night and had to make alternative plans.  The gentleman at customer services arranged to have my order delivered the following day between 5-6pm  the order came WITHOUT bags (which I had previously asked for) which then meant that I had to dump ¬£60 worth of shopping in my hall way and to top it all off I have now checked my bank and it seems I have been charged twice by Tesco for my entire order.  The gentleman that I spoke to previously in Customer Services sent me through a voucher by email to the value of ¬£10 but I m afraid after all this hassle that does not even come close to making up for all the inconvenience it has caused.  I would be grateful if you could resolve this situation as soon as possible as I really am completely dissatisfied with the service I have received and would consider using other supermarkets in the future if this is not resolved quickly.  Thanks.

Our shopping was due to be delivered between 9 and 10pm last night. We called Tesco at 10.30 and they couldn t get hold of anyone to find out where our shopping was. He said someone will call us in the morning. I gave it until 9.30 before making the call myself. I was shocked to find out the driver had run out of time and our shopping was returned to the store and put back on the shelves and our money refunded! I was speechless that no one had contacted us to let us know. We were relying on items for today  it will be re sent tonight but means we now have to buy food to see us through today. I understand this situation can happen but I think it could be handled better. Luckily we have enough money for you to take the money from our account before the last lot is refunded.

Would like to share my awful experience at Tescos Yate last night   went in with my other half to buy the old ps4 on offer for ¬£149.99 and the service we received by the night shift manager Damion or damo as his name badge read was awful unprofessional and just rude.   After spending 15 mins in the store we tracked down someone to talk to about buying a ps4 we were passed on to a manager who told my other half that they have the stock but it  wasn t for that offer . Confused we walked back to where the PlayStation stock was and picked up a ps4 ticket which had the offer on it   saying  take this ticket to electrical / click and collect to buy    A staff member named Sam was helpful and went out the back to get us a 500gb one telling us what a great offer it was and saying he has brought one himself a few hours before. He brought out an old ps4 500 gb   I then asked if they had any of the 1TB in stock as it was such a great offer we thought we would pay the extra and upgrade.  He went back and bought us out an ps4 1Tb and walked us down stairs to the till to pay as the tills were all shut upstairs.  As we were waiting to pay the night shift manager Damo walked up to us and took the ps4 out of Sams hands. His first words to us were  you were told this is an online only deal . He then repeated to Sam that the offer was online only and that we could only order online and collect in store. We then tried to do this but it said it was out of stock   even though the stock was physically there in front of us!!!  We then asked if we could have the 500Gb to which we were told they didn t have any....even though 5 mins ago Sam had brought one out to us!!  I then went onto the Tesco website to show that it does say in selected stores not just online only to be told again by Damo that it is an.online deal only by hot UK deals. Even though staff had told us they had brought one in store   and the tickets were out for the offer. We left empty handed and confused by Tescos Yate clear mistake. I don t understand why we were talked to like we were worthless and told time and time again that we were wrong  and then lied to about stock that we could see!!!!  Please let me know what you think about this service and if you think its acceptable.  Julya.
